Forms.name: FSA-2001 Request for Direct Loan Assistance

parts.name: Part A
parts.description: Individual applicants and married applicants with a non-applicant spouse will complete Items 1 through 16. Items 11, 14 and 15 are voluntary. *Race, ethnicity, and gender information is requested by the Federal Government to monitor FSA's compliance with Federal laws prohibiting discrimination against applicants. Applicants are not required to furnish this information but are encouraged to do so. Failure to provide this information may result in not receiving targeted funds for which the applicant may be eligible. This information will not be used to evaluate this application.

items.comment: Enter your full legal name as it appears on your driver's license or State-issued ID card.

items.name: Email Address
items.comment: Enter your email address.

items.name: Mailing Address (including Zip Code)
items.comment: Enter your mailing address.

items.name: Same as Physical Address
items.comment: Is your mailing address the same as your physical address?

items.comment: Enter your physical address if it is different from your mailing address.

items.name: County of Residence
items.comment: Enter the county where you reside.

items.comment: Enter your home, mobile, and business telephone numbers, as applicable.

items.name: Primary

items.name: County of Operation Headquarters
items.comment: Enter the county where the operation headquarters is located.

items.name: Date of Birth (MM/DD/YYYY)

items.comment: Enter your 9-digit social security number (without dashes).

items.comment: Enter the name and address of your employer, if applicable.

items.name: Telephone Number (Area Code)
items.comment: Enter your employer's telephone number, if applicable.

items.name: Applicant is [citizenship status]
items.comment:
Select your citizenship status.

Note: If you are a non-citizen national, qualified alien, or refugee, you must provide documentation of your immigration status.

items.name: Race
items.comment:
Select your race. More than one checkbox may be selected. 

Note: Providing your race is voluntary unless you are applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant.

items.name: Veteran Status
items.comment:
Select your veteran status. 

Note: A veteran is anyone who has served in the U.S. armed services. A veteran farmer without military experience does not qualify as a veteran.

items.name: Marital Status

items.comment:

Note: Providing your ethnicity is voluntary unless you are applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant.

items.name: Gender
items.comment:

Note: Providing your gender is voluntary unless you are applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant.

Items 7, 10 and 11 are voluntary. The other spouse will complete Items 13 through 23; Items 19, 22 and 23 are voluntary. Items 25 through 28 pertain to both applicants jointly.

parts.name: Part C
parts.description: An entity is a corporation, formal, joint operation, Limited Liability Corporation, Trust or other legal business organization comprised of 1 or more individuals which may or may not have an entity name or entity tax identification number. Organizations operating as non-profit entities and Estates are not considered eligible entities for Farm Loan Program purposes. Informal entities may leave Items 3 through 8 blank. Items 21, 24 and 25 are voluntary. All other information must be provided on each entity associated with the operation and each individual member of the associated entity. NOTE: Individual liability is required regardless of entity type.

items.comment: Enter the full legal name of the ENTITY as shown on Articles of Incorporation, partnership agreement, as filed with the Secretary of State, etc. If you are farming as an informal joint operation or under an “assumed” name, enter the name under which the joint operation farms; otherwise, leave blank.

items.comment: Enter the entity’s registration number.

items.name: Tax Identification Number (9 digits)

items.name: Does entity Contain Embedded Entity?

Otherwise, check “NO” and proceed to field 14.

items.name: Acres Rented

items.name: Purpose of Loan
items.comment:
Enter the purpose of the loan request. Indicate whether this will be an Annual Operating, Term Operating, Farm Ownership, or Emergency Loan. If applying for multiple loans, enter the purpose of your first loan request here. 

Do you need an annual operating loan to pay seed, taxes, insurance, to purchase feeder calves or stockers etc? If so, you will need an Annual Operating Loan.

Do you need to purchase equipment, livestock, or refinance farm-related debt? If so, you will need an Term Operating loan.

Do you need to purchase real estate, make capital improvements to the farm, or new construction projects? You will need a Farm Ownership loan.

Have you suffered a loss to your farming operation due to a natural disaster? If so, you will need an Emergency loan.

Emergency loan programs are triggered by a natural disaster as designated by the Secretary of Agriculture. These loans help producers who suffered qualifying farm related losses directly caused by the disaster and a county declared or designated as a disaster or quarantined area.

Please note that more than one loan or any combination of two loans may be requested. If so, please put your first loan request in 4A and your second loan request in 5A. For example, an applicant may request an Annual Operating, Term Operating and a Farm Ownership loan at the same time. Another example, an applicant can request a combination of any two loans.

items.name: Amount Requested
items.comment: Enter the loan amount requested for the first loan request.

items.name: Purpose of Loan
items.comment:
If applying for multiple loans, enter the purpose of your second loan request. Indicate whether this will be an Annual Operating, Term Operating, Farm Ownership, or Emergency Loan.

Do you need an annual operating loan to pay seed, taxes, insurance, to purchase feeder calves or stockers etc? If so, you will need an Annual Operating Loan.

Do you need to purchase equipment, livestock, or refinance farm-related debt? If so, you will need an Term Operating loan.

Do you need to purchase real estate, make capital improvements to the farm, or new construction projects? You will need a Farm Ownership loan.

Have you suffered a loss to your farming operation due to a natural disaster? If so, you will need an Emergency loan.

Emergency loan programs are triggered by a natural disaster as designated by the Secretary of Agriculture. These loans help producers who suffered qualifying farm related losses directly caused by the disaster and a county declared or designated as a disaster or quarantined area.

Please note that more than one loan or any combination of two loans may be requested. If so, please put your first loan request in 4A and your second loan request in 5A. For example, an applicant may request an Annual Operating, Term Operating and a Farm Ownership loan at the same time. Another example, an applicant can request a combination of any two loans.

items.name: Amount Requested
items.comment: Enter the loan amount requested for the second loan request.

items.name: Description of Operation
items.comment: Provide a detailed summary of the operation. (Include type and size of the farm operation, years in operation, labor, production yield, location(s), number of enterprises/commodities, etc).

items.name: Business Under Other Name
items.comment:
Select “YES” if you (or any member of the entity) have ever conducted business under another name, otherwise check “NO”.

If “YES” provide names used in item 9.

items.name: Previous FSA or FmHA Loans
items.comment: Select “YES” if you (or any member of the entity) have ever obtained a direct or guaranteed farm loan from FSA or the Farmers Home Administration; if not check “NO”.

items.name: Debt Forgiveness
items.comment:
Select “YES” if the government ever forgave any previous debt through a write-down, write-off, compromise, adjustment, reduction, charge-off, paying a loss on a guarantee, or bankruptcy.

If “YES”, provide details in Item 9; otherwise check “NO”.

items.name: Delinquent on Federal Debt
items.comment:
Select “YES” if you (or any member of the entity) are delinquent on any federal debt. Federal Debt includes education loans, delinquent taxes, obligations at Natural Resources Conservation Service, obligations to FCIC, etc.

If “YES,” provide details in Item 9, otherwise check “NO”.

items.name: Pending Litigation
items.comment:
Select “YES” if you (any member of the entity, or the entity itself) are involved in any pending litigation.

If “YES,” provide details in Item 9, otherwise check “NO”.

items.name: Bankruptcy
items.comment:
Select “YES” if you (or any member of the entity) have filed a petition for bankruptcy.

If “YES,” provide details in Item 9, otherwise check “NO”.

items.name: Employee Relationship
items.comment:
Select “YES” if you are an employee, related to an employee, or closely associated with an employee of the Farm Service Agency. If not, check “NO.”

If “YES” provide details in Item 9.

items.name: Farming Experience
items.comment:
Select “YES” if you are currently farming, or have in the past.

If “YES” provide the number of years and a brief explanation of your experience in Item 9.

items.name: Additional Answers
items.comment: Provide explanations to any “YES” responses for Items 1–8.

items.name: Statements
items.comment: Read statements and certifications in Items 10–17.

parts.name: Part F
parts.description: CERTIFICATION: I certify that the information provided is true, complete, and correct to the best of my knowledge and is provided in good faith to obtain a loan. (WARNING: Section 1001 of Title 18, United States Code, provides for criminal penalties to those who provide false statements to the Government. If any information is found to be false or incomplete, such finding may be grounds for denial of the requested action).

Forms.description: Use this form to apply for all direct loans and identify all applicants.

Forms.name: FSA-2002 Three-Year Financial History

items.name: Name
items.comment: Enter your full legal name as it appears on your driver's license or State-issued ID card.

items.name: Years
items.comment: Indicate the last three years in the spaces provided at the top of each column.

items.name: Crop Sales
items.comment: For each year, enter the total dollar amount for all crop sales.

items.name: Livestock & Poultry Sales
items.comment: For each year, enter the total dollar amount for all sales of livestock and poultry.

items.name: Dairy Livestock Sales
items.comment: For each year, enter the total dollar amount for all sales of dairy livestock (i.e. dairy cull cows, cull bulls, dairy heifers, etc.).

items.name: Milk Sales
items.comment: For each year, enter the total dollar amount for all sales of milk.

items.name: Livestock Product Sales
items.comment: For each year, enter the total dollar amount for all sales of livestock products (i.e. fur, leather, wool, eggs, and livestock meats, such as pork, veal, beef, lamb, etc.).

items.name: Ag. Program Payments
items.comment: For each year, enter the total dollar amount of all Ag Program payments received.

items.name: Crop Insurance Proceeds
items.comment: For each year, enter the total dollar amount of all crop insurance proceeds received.

items.name: Custom Hire Income
items.comment: For each year, enter the total dollar amount of all custom hire income.

items.name: Other Income
items.comment: For each year, enter the total dollar amount of all other farm-related income (i.e. refunds, co-op dividends, farm rebates, manure sales, seed sales, fertilizer sales, machine rental income, farmland rental income, etc.)

items.name: TOTAL OPERATING INCOME
items.comment: For each year, enter the TOTAL income by adding the sums from lines 1 through 9.

parts.name: Part B
parts.description: Enter the expense amount for each item listed in B.1.-B24 for each of the most recent 3 years.
parts.title: Operating Expenses

items.name: Car and Truck
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to cars and trucks, including gas, tires, licenses, maintenance, and repairs.

items.name: Chemicals
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to chemical substances used on the farm such as herbicides, pesticides, and fungicides.

items.name: Conservation
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to protecting, maintaining, and restoring farmland (i.e. nutrient management plans, tiling, brush control, draining systems, gully structures, poultry energy updates, etc.).

items.name: Custom Hire
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to services performed on your farm by another self-employed person or business, including contract hire work and machine hire work.

items.name: Depreciation
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to the reduction of value of assets over time, due to wear and tear.

items.name: Feed Supplement
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to feed supplements (phosphates, calcium, and trace mineral mixtures) given to grazing animals during the dry and rainy seasons.

items.name: Feed, Grain, and Roughage
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to feed, grain, and roughage, including concentrates and hay.

items.name: Fertilizers and Lime
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to fertilizers and lime used on the farm.

items.name: Freight and Trucking
items.comment: For each year, enter your total transportation costs related to moving goods to and from the farm.

items.name: Gas/Fuel/Oil
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to gas, fuel, and oil for farm usage.

items.name: Insurance
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to insurance premiums paid to protect against farm loss, damage, illness, and death.

items.name: Labor Hired
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to hired labor.

items.name: Rent - Machinery/Equipment/Vehicle
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to machinery, equipment, and vehicle rentals.

items.name: Rent - Land/Animals
items.comment:
For each year, enter your total costs related to rental payments for leased land and animals (hired out at a specific rate for a specific time). 

Note: Land rent is for a temporary purpose that permits the tenant to use a piece of land owned by the landlord in exchange of rent. Animal rent includes animals who are hired out at a specific rate for a specific time.

items.name: Repairs and Maintenance
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to repairs and maintence to fix, mend, or restore items to operational soundness.

items.name: Seeds and Plants
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to seeds, plants, and other inputs for crops.

items.name: Supplies
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to essential supplies needed for the farm (for example, equipment, tools, and twines).

items.name: Taxes - Real Estate
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to taxes levied on real estate property paid to local and state governments.

items.name: Utilities
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to basic utilities, including water, electricity, gas, trash, and sewage. Include your technology subscriptions (cable tv, internet, security, and phone services).

items.name: Veterinary/Breeding/Medicine
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to the treatment of animals related to disease, birth, injuries, and medications.

items.name: Purchases for Resale
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to wholesale costs attributed to the production of goods sold by your business.

items.name: Other Expenses
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to any other expenses not listed above (such as costs associated with appraisals, attorney fees, surveys, accounting costs, bank fees, closing costs, etc).

items.name: Other - Irrigation
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs related to Irrigation, the agricultural process of applying controlled amounts of water to land to assist in the production of crops.

items.name: Interest
items.comment: For each year, enter the total amount of interest paid on loans (borrowed money).

items.name: Total Operating Expenses
items.comment: For each year, enter your total costs by adding up all expenses in Part B items 1-24.

items.name: Years
items.comment: Indicate the last three years in the spaces provided at the top of each column.

items.name: Owner Withdrawal
items.comment: For each year, enter the total dollar amount of all family living expenses (recurring monthly expenses) and other non-farm-related debt payments (i.e. car loans, personal loans, credit cards, etc.).

items.name: Income Taxes
items.comment:
For each year, enter the total State and Federal income taxes paid. 

Note: You can obtain this information from your Federal and State Tax return forms.

items.name: Non-Farm Income
items.comment: For each year, enter the total amount of income received from non-farm sources.

items.name: Non-Farm Expense
items.comment: For each year, enter the total amount of expenses associated with non-farm businesses and charitable contributions.

items.name: Term Principal Payment
items.comment: For each year, enter the total dollar amount of principle paid toward the original loan amounts for all loans covering the costs of machinery, livestock, and real estate.

items.name: Operating Loan Advance
items.comment:
For each year, enter the total dollar amount of full or partial operating loan advances. 

Note: May include a revolving account.

items.name: Term Loan Advance
items.comment: For each year, enter the total dollar amount received for term loan advances. Include loans for capital purchases such as machinery, equipment, breeding livestock, real estate, etc.

items.name: Operating Loan Payment
items.comment:
For each year, enter the total dollar amount paid for operating loans. If you received loans from more than one source combine them to provide a total.

Note: A farm operating loan or line of credit is a revolving debt that can be borrowed and paid back to fund the yearly operating costs of farm operations.

items.name: Capital Sales
items.comment: For each year, enter the total dollar amount received from the sale of depreciable items (equipment, breeding livestock, etc.) and real estate.

items.name: Capital Contributions
items.comment:
For each year, enter the total dollar amount of inflows of capital that are not the result of business operations or other income. 

Note: Capital contributions include gifts, inheritance, lottery winnings, the gifted value of substantial asset purchases for less than market value, and the capital contributions of entity members.

items.name: Capital Expenditures
items.comment: For each year, enter the total dollar amount of purchases of depreciable items (equipment, breeding livestock, etc) and real estate.

items.name: Capital Withdrawals
items.comment:
For each year, enter the total dollar amount of outflows of capital that are not the result of business operations or owner withdrawals. 

Note: Capital withdrawals usually include gifts, the gift value of substantial sales of assets for less than market value, and withdrawal of capital of entity members.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Provide your signature.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter today's date using the MM/DD/YYYY format.

Forms.description: Use this form to provide a detailed three-year financial history. This form is not required. Applicant may submit alternate documents that provide the information collected on this form.

Forms.name: FSA-2003 Three-Year Production History

items.name: Name
items.comment: Enter your full legal name as it appears on your driver's license or State-issued ID card.

items.name: Dairy Cows
items.comment: Indicate the last three years in the spaces provided at the top of each column, starting with the most recent year.

items.name: Herd Number
items.comment: For each year, enter the average number of milk cows.

items.name: Lbs. of Milk Sold
items.comment: For each year, enter the total amount of milk sold (in pounds).

items.name: Average Production Per Cow
items.comment:
For each year, enter the average milk production per cow. 

Note: The average production per cow is the pounds of milk (1b) divided by the number of cows (1a).

items.name: Calves Sold
items.comment: For each year, enter the total number of calves sold.

items.name: Calves Average Sale Weight
items.comment: For each year, enter the average weight of calves at the time they were sold.

items.name: Number of Cows Culled
items.comment: For each year, enter the total number of cull cows sold and cows that died.

items.name: Livestock Type
items.comment:
For this section, enter the type of livestock being raised (cattle, hogs, sheep, etc.). For greater clarity (when applicable), indicate the specific type of livestock, such as brood cows, market animals, calves, etc. 


Note: Each livestock type should be entered separately.

items.name: Units Raised
items.comment: For the livestock type specified above, enter the number of livestock that were raised during each year.

items.name: Units Purchased
items.comment: For the livestock type specified above, enter the number of livestock that were purchased during each year.

items.name: Total Units
items.comment: For the livestock type specified above, enter the total number of livestock that were both raised and purchased during each year, by adding items 1a and 1b.

items.name: Units Sold
items.comment: For the livestock type specified above, enter the total number of livestock that were sold during each year.

items.name: Death Loss
items.comment: For the livestock type specified above, enter the total number of livestock animals that were lost due to death each year.

items.name: Purchase Weight
items.comment: For the livestock type specified above, enter the average weight per unit for livestock that were purchased in each of the three preceding years.

items.name: Sales Weight
items.comment: For the livestock type specified above, enter the average weight per unit for livestock that were sold in each of the three preceding years.

parts.description: List all creditors to whom you are presently indebted, or provide alternate documents that provide the same information. In the case of an entity, the entity and each individual member must complete this form or provide alternate documents.

Forms.name: FSA-2006 Property Owned and Leased

items.name: Name of Applicant
items.comment: Enter your full legal name as it appears on your driver's license or State-issued ID card. If you are representing an entity, enter the legal name of the entity.

parts.name: Part A
parts.description: Include all land owned, to be owned, or leased.
parts.title: Land

items.name: Owner of Record
items.comment: Enter the name of the legal landowner (the deed and title holder) of the property that you will farm.

items.name: Description
items.comment: Enter a general description for each property that you own, lease/rent, or plan to purchase (for example section, township, range, and current use of land).

items.name: County
items.comment: Enter the name of the county where the farmland is located.

items.name: Farm No.
items.comment:
Enter the farm tract number of the land you own, lease or plan to purchase. The farm tract number is available from the Farm Program Section (FSA).   

Note: For newly purchased land, it is required that you obtain a tract number from the Farm Program Section.

items.name: Total Acres
items.comment: Enter the total number of acres associated with this farm tract number.

items.name: Crop Acres
items.comment: Enter the total number of crop acres specifically assigned to this farm tract number.

items.name: Oral/Written Lease
items.comment: If you are leasing the land, state whether the lease is oral or written.

items.name: Crop Share
items.comment: Enter the percentage of the crop share that you will own after harvest.

items.name: Cash Rent
items.comment: If renting this property, enter the rent payment amount due to the landowner.

items.name: Expiration Date
items.comment: If leasing this property, enter the expiration date of the lease contract.

items.name: Total Acres
items.comment: Enter the total number of acres associated with this farm tract number.

items.name: Crop Acres
items.comment: Enter the total number of crop acres specifically assigned to this farm tract number.

items.name: Oral/Written Lease
items.comment: If you are leasing the land, state whether the lease is oral or written.

items.name: Crop Share
items.comment: Enter the percentage of the crop share that you will own after harvest.

items.name: Cash Rent
items.comment: If renting this property, enter the rent payment amount due to the landowner.

items.name: Expiration Date
items.comment: If leasing this property, enter the expiration date of the lease contract.

parts.name: Part B
parts.description: Include only equipment/livestock to be purchased, currently leased, or to be leased.
parts.title: Equipment/Livestock

items.name: Owner of Record
items.comment: Enter the owner of the equipment or livestock that you currently lease or plan to lease (or purchase).

items.name: Description
items.comment: Describe the equipment or livestock that you currently lease or plan to lease (or purchase). Include color, serial number, make/model, tag number, brand, description, and color.

items.name: Number of Units
items.comment: Enter the number of pieces of equipment or livestock that you currently lease or plan to lease (or purchase).

items.name: Rent ($)
items.comment: Enter the rent payment amount due to the Owner of record.

items.name: Share (%)
items.comment: Enter the percentage share for the equipment or livestock that you currently lease or plan to lease (or purchase).

items.name: Type of Lease
items.comment: If you have a lease, indicate whether it is a written or oral lease.

items.name: Expiration Date
items.comment: If leasing equipment and/or livestock, enter the expiration date of the lease contract.

parts.name: Part C
parts.description: I certify that the information provided is true, complete, and correct to the best of my knowledge and is provided in good faith. (Warning: Section 1001 of title 18, United States Code, provides for criminal penalties to those who provide false statements. If any information is found to be false or incomplete, such finding may be grounds for denial of the requested action.)
parts.title: Certification

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Provide your signature.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter today's date using the MM/DD/YYYY format.

Forms.description: Use this form to indicate any property, including land, equipment and livestock that are owned, or to be owned, leased or to be leased by the applicants.

Forms.name: FSA-2007 Cosigner Application and Agreement

items.name: Cosigner's Exact Full Legal Name
items.comment: Enter your full legal name as it appears on your driver's license or State-issued ID card.

items.name: Cosigner's Email Address
items.comment: Enter your email address.

items.name: Cosigner's Mailing Address
items.comment: Enter your mailing address.

items.name: Same as Physical Address
items.comment: Is your mailing address the same as your physical address?

items.name: Cosigner's Physical Address
items.comment: Enter your physical address if it is different from your mailing address.

items.name: Cosigner's County of Residence
items.comment: Enter the county where you reside.

items.name: Cosigner's Contact Telephone Numbers
items.comment: Enter your home, mobile, and business telephone numbers, as applicable.

items.name: Applicant for Which You Are Agreeing to Cosign
items.comment: Enter the full legal name of the applicant for which you are agreeing to cosign.

items.name: Cosigner's Date of Birth
items.comment: Enter your date of birth in the format MM/DD/YYYY.

items.name: Cosigner's Social Security Number
items.comment: Enter your 9-digit social security number (without dashes).

items.name: Name and Address of Cosigner's Employer
items.comment: Enter the name and address of your employer, if applicable.

items.name: Cosigner Citizenship Quesion
items.comment:
Select your citizenship status.

If you are a non-citizen national, qualified alien, or refugee, you must provide documentation of your immigration status.

items.name: Race
items.comment: Select your race. More than one checkbox may be selected.

items.name: Veteran Status
items.comment:
Select your veteran status. 

Note: A veteran is anyone who has served in the U.S. armed services. A veteran farmer without military experience does not qualify as a veteran.

items.name: Marital Status
items.comment: Select your marital status.

items.name: Cosigner Ethnicity Question
items.comment: Select your ethnicity.

items.name: Gender
items.comment: Select your gender.

items.name: Cosigner Legal Competency Question
items.comment: Select YES to indicate that you have the legal capacity, age, mental capacity, and authority to enter into a legally binding agreement. Otherwise, select NO.

items.name: Cosigner Initials
items.comment: Sign with your initials.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter today's date using the MM/DD/YYYY format.

parts.name: Part B
parts.title: Notifications, Certifications, and Acknowledgment for the Cosigner

items.name: Yes/No Question #1
items.comment:
Select YES if you ever conducted business under any other name. Otherwise, select NO.  

Note: If you selected YES, provide the names used in Item 8.

items.name: Yes/No Question #2
items.comment: Select YES if you ever obtained a direct or guaranteed farm loan from FSA or the Farmers Home Administration. Otherwise, select NO.

items.name: Yes/No Question #3
items.comment:
Select YES if the government ever forgave any debt through write-down, write-off, compromise, adjustment, reduction, charge-off, paying a loss on a guaranteed loan, or bankruptcy.  Otherwise, select NO.

Note: If you selected YES, provide a detailed explanation in Item 8.

items.name: Yes/No Question #4
items.comment:
Select YES if you are delinquent on any federal debt (including education loans, delinquent taxes, obligations to the Natural Resources Conservation Service, obligations to FCIC, or outstanding Federal judgments). Otherwise, select NO.

Note: If you selected YES, provide a detailed explanation in Item 8.

items.name: Yes/No Question #5
items.comment:
Select YES if you are involved in any pending litigation (i.e. divorce, lawsuit, etc.).  Otherwise, select NO.

Note: If you selected YES, provide a detailed explanation in Item 8.

items.name: Yes/No Question #6
items.comment:
Select YES if you have ever filed a petition for bankruptcy.  Otherwise, select NO. 

Note: If you selected YES, provide a detailed explanation in Item 8.

items.name: Yes/No Question #7
items.comment:
Select YES if you are an employee, related to an employee, or closely associated with an employee of the Farm Service Agency.  Otherwise, select NO. 

Note: If you selected YES, provide a detailed explanation in Item 8.

items.name: Additional answers
items.comment: Provide explanations for any YES responses to Items 1-7. Use additional space as needed.

items.name: Cosigner Initials
items.comment: Sign with your initials.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter today's date using the MM/DD/YYYY format.

items.name: Cosigner Initials
items.comment: Sign with your initials.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter today's date using the MM/DD/YYYY format.

items.name: Cosigner Initials
items.comment: Sign with your initials.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter today's date using the MM/DD/YYYY format.

items.name: Cosigner Initials
items.comment: Sign with your initials.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter today's date using the MM/DD/YYYY format.

parts.name: Part C
parts.description: CERTIFICATION: I acknowledge receipt of the above provisions, and by signing acknowledge that I have read this form, and accept the conditions stated herein. I further certify that the information provided is true, complete, and correct to the best of my knowledge and is provided in good faith to assist the applicant to obtain a loan. (WARNING: Section 1001 of Title 18, United States Code, provides for criminal penalties to those who provide false statements to the Government. If any information is found to be false or incomplete, such finding may be grounds for denial of the requested action).
parts.title: Certification and Cosigner Signatures

items.name: Signature of Cosigner
items.comment: Provide your signature.

items.name: Date Signed
items.comment: Enter today's date using the MM/DD/YYYY format.

items.name: Name of Agency Official Receiving Application
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: Name of the person who received the application and credit report fee.

items.name: Date FSA-2007 Received
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: The date the application was received, and date stamped by the office.

items.name: Date FSA-2001 Received From Applicant Listed in Part A, Item 6
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: The date the form FSA-2001 was received, and date stamped by the office.

items.name: Amount of Credit Report Fee Received
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: The credit report fee is for pulling your credit report. The fee depends on how the applicant applies.

items.name: Date Credit Report Fee Received
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: The date the credit report fee was received.

Forms.description: Use this form to advise a non-applicant party that the collection of information is voluntary, and that failure to provide necessary information may delay processing or cause the rejection of the application. The form also addresses disclosure of collected information by FSA.

Forms.name: FSA-2014 Verification of Income

items.name: To
items.comment:
Enter the full legal name of your employer and their physical address (including the street, city, and state). 

Note: An employer is an institution or person who pays you wages for work performed.

items.name: From
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY - An FSA Agency Official must provide the name and physical address of the office servicing the loan request (including the street, city, and state).

items.name: Certification
items.comment: Read the certification statement.  It is important for this form to go directly from FSA to the employer and then returned directly to FSA.

items.name: Name
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY - Enter the name of the FSA Agency Official processing this form.

items.name: Title
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY - The FSA Agency Official processing this form must enter their official title.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY - The Agency Official processing this form must provide their signature here.

items.name: Date
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY - The FSA Agency Official processing this form must enter the date.

items.name: Applicant's Name and Address
items.comment: Enter the applicant's full legal name and mailing address (including the street, city, and state).

items.name: Statement
items.comment: Read the statement.

items.name: Date of employment
items.comment: Enter the applicant's start date of employment.

items.name: Position
items.comment: Enter the applicant's current position or job title.

items.name: Probability of continued employment
items.comment: Enter the applicant's probability of continued employment. Do not leave blank.

items.name: Base pay
items.comment:
Select the appropriate pay period and include the dollar amount earned for the period. If HOURLY is selected, provide the number of hours per week in the space provided.     

Note: Annually is gross (pre-tax) salary earned over twelve months.  Monthly is the gross salary earned over a 30-day period.   Weekly is the gross salary earned over a 7-day period.  Hourly is the gross salary earned per hour.  Other refers to contract income and income from hired labor.

items.name: Past Year
items.comment:
In the Past Year column, enter the Base Pay, Overtime, Commissions, and Bonus amounts earned by the applicant in the last 12 months.  

Note: Base pay is the rate of compensation an employee receives in exchange for services. Overtime refers to work performed in excess of a standard workday or week. Commissions are fees paid to an agent or employee per transaction or service.  A bonus is paid in addition to base pay usually as a reward for good performance.

items.name: Current year to date pay
items.comment:
Enter the current year to date in the space provided.   Then, enter the Base Pay, Overtime, Commissions, and Bonus amounts earned year-to-date.  

Note: Base pay is the rate of compensation an employee receives in exchange for services. Overtime refers to work performed in excess of a standard workday or week. Commissions are fees paid to an agent or employee per transaction or service.  A bonus is paid in addition to base pay usually as a reward for good performance.

items.name: Project next year pay
items.comment:
In the Project Next Year column, enter the Base Pay, Overtime, Commissions, and Bonus amounts projected to be earned by the applicant in the next 12 months.  

Note: Base pay is the rate of compensation an employee receives in exchange for services. Overtime refers to work performed in excess of a standard workday or week. Commissions are fees paid to an agent or employee per transaction or service.  A bonus is paid in addition to base pay usually as a reward for good performance.

items.name: Source
items.comment: Enter any source of additional income received by the applicant but not listed in Part B.

items.name: Frequency
items.comment: Enter the frequency that any other income is received.

items.name: Amount
items.comment: Enter the amount of the other income received.

items.name: Comments
items.comment: Enter a detailed explanation of other income.

parts.name: Part D
parts.description: Federal statutes provide severe civil and criminal penalties for any person who knowingly makes false or fraudulent statements or representations to a government agency or officer with the intention of influencing any action by such agency or officer.
parts.title: Certification

items.name: Statement
items.comment: Read certification provided on the form.

items.name: Name
items.comment: The employer processing this form must print their name here.

items.name: Title
items.comment: The employer processing this form must enter their official title here.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: The employer processing this form must provide their signature.

items.name: Phone Number
items.comment: The employer processing this form must provide their telephone number.

items.name: Date
items.comment: The employer processing this form must date enter today's date.

Forms.description: Use this form to prepare a current balance sheet. It is generally a snapshot of the applicants' assets and debts as of a certain date.

Forms.name: FSA-2015 Verification of Debts and Assets

items.name: To
items.comment:
Enter the full legal name of the creditor and the creditor's physical address (including the street, city, and state).

Note: A creditor refers to a financial institution or person who is owed money.

items.name: From
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY - An FSA Agency Official must provide the name and physical address of the office servicing the loan request (including the street, city, and state).

items.name: Name and Address of Applicant
items.comment: Enter the applicant's full legal name as it appears on their driver's license or State-issued ID card.

items.name: Name
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY - Enter the name of the FSA Agency Official processing this form.

items.name: Title
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY - The FSA Agency Official processing this form must enter their official title.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY - The Agency Official processing this form must provide their signature here.

items.name: Date
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY - The FSA Agency Official processing this form must enter the date.

items.name: Type of debt
items.comment:
At the top of each column, enter the type of debt for each account verified.  For example, indicate if the debt is a personal or business debt. Is the debt secured, unsecured, revolving, or an installment debt?

Note: The following items will be addressed by the creditor.

items.name: Account number
items.comment: For each column, enter the account number to identify the applicant's specific accounts for each column.

items.name: Date of origination
items.comment: For each account column, enter the date that the loan or account was originally opened.

items.name: Current principal balance
items.comment: For each account column, enter the principal amount still owed on the original debt (not including interest or finance charges).

items.name: Accrued interest
items.comment: For each account column, enter the amount of interest that has been incurred and has not been paid.

items.name: Daily interest accrual
items.comment: For each account column, enter the daily dollar amount of interest added to the account balance.

items.name: Effective date of Items C and D
items.comment: For each account column, enter the date on which the loan or account is being currently reviewed for items 1C and 1D.

items.name: Original loan amount/LOC ceiling
items.comment: For each account column, enter the principal amount of the loan originally made to the applicant.

items.name: Last date payment made
items.comment: For each account column, enter the last date a payment was made on the loan or account.

items.name: Interest rate
items.comment: For each account column, enter the Interest Rate and indicate in the space below whether it is a Fixed Rate (does not fluctuate during the period of the loan) or a Variable Rate (fluctuates over time as it is based on a benchmark interest rate or index).

items.name: Installment amount
items.comment: For each account column, enter the installment amount (payment amount due).

items.name: Next Installment due date
items.comment: For each account column, enter the due date for the next regular payment on the loan or account.

items.name: Amount past due
items.comment: For each account column, enter the past due amount for payments that have not been paid by the deadline.

items.name: Description of collateral
items.comment: For each account column, enter a brief description or name of the item(s) used to secure the loan or account.

items.name: Maturity date
items.comment: For each account column, enter the date that the final payment is due on the loan or account.

items.name: Applicant's repayment record is
items.comment: Indicate whether payments are Prompt (payments are always made on time), Usually Prompt (under normal conditions, payment is made on time), or Not Prompt (payment is not made on time).

items.name: Number of years applicant has conducted business with you
items.comment: Enter the number of years the applicant has conducted business transactions with the institution.

items.name: Yes/No Question #1
items.comment:
Select YES, if your loan instruments contain a HEREAFTER ACQUIRED CLAUSE. Otherwise, select NO.

Note: The HEREAFTER ACQUIRED CLAUSE adds any asset the debtor acquires (at a later point in time) to the list of collateral that was originally put in place to secure the loan.

items.name: Yes/No Question #2
items.comment: Select YES, if there is a clause in the loan contract that allows the borrower to receive additional funds after the loan is initially disbursed.  Otherwise, select NO.

items.name: Yes/No Question #3
items.comment: Select YES, if you would enter into another loan agreement with the borrower.  Select NO, if you would not enter into another loan agreement with the borrower.

items.name: Yes/No Question #4
items.comment: Select YES, if you would extend additional credit with a FSA Guarantee in place.  Select NO if you would not enter into another loan agreement with the borrower even with a FSA Guarantee in place.

items.name: Type of asset
items.comment: At the top of each column, enter any items of value that the applicant pledged that can be used for security (i.e. cash, jewelry, receivables, prepaid expenses, inventory, equipment, livestock, land, automobile, etc.).

items.name: Account number
items.comment: In each column, enter the associated account number which is a unique set of numbers used to identify the borrower's specific account.

items.name: Date of origination
items.comment: In each column, enter the initial date that the loan or account was originally opened.

items.name: Balance
items.comment: In each column, enter the balance of the account (in dolllars).

items.name: Interest rate
items.comment:
In each column, enter the interest rate. 

Note: The interest rate is the amount a borrower is charged for borrowing money.

items.name: Annuity amount
items.comment:
In each column, enter the annuity amount. 

Note: The annuity amount is a fixed amount of money paid at equal intervals (for example, regular deposits to a savings account, monthly insurance payments, or pension payments).

items.name: Maturity date
items.comment:
In each column, enter the maturity date. 

Note: The maturity date is the date that the final payment is due on a loan or account.

items.name: Yes/No Question #1
items.comment: Select YES if you impose penalties when a borrower's deposit or investment accounts are withdrawn prior to maturity.  Otherwise, select NO.

items.name: Additional information
items.comment: Enter any additional information that you feel may be important to note concerning the account.

items.name: Name of Institution's Representative
items.comment: Enter the full legal name of the Institution's Representative who filled out this form.

items.name: Title of Institution's Representative
items.comment: Enter the professional title of the Institution's Representative who filled out this form.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: In you are the Institution's Representative who filled out this form, please sign here.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter today's date using the MM/DD/YYYY format.

items.name: Telephone Number
items.comment: Enter your direct telephone number.

Forms.description: Use this form to verify the debts and assets of applicants applying for direct loan assistance or settlement of an unpaid FSA debt. Applicants must complete Items 1 and 3 at a minimum and other items as applicable. FSA will send the form to applicable financial institutions. Alternatively, applicants may request that their financial institution obtain the form directly from the USDA eForms service web site and complete the items that are applicable to the account that the applicant has with that institution.

Forms.name: FSA-2037 Farm Business Plan Worksheet (Balance Sheet)

items.name: Name
items.comment:
Enter your full legal name as it appears on your driver's license or State-issued ID card.

Note: An entity representative will need to complete a balance sheet for the entity. Additionally, each entity member will need to complete an individual balance sheet.

items.name: Date of Balance Sheet
items.comment: Enter the date you are completing this balance sheet in the format MM/DD/YYYY.

parts.name: Part A
parts.description: Current assets are FARM assets that can be sold immediately or consumed and converted to cash within 12 months.
parts.title: Current Assets

items.name: Cash and Equivalents
items.comment: Enter the account type and dollar value of farm cash on hand and equivalents (farm checking or savings accounts).

items.name: Marketable Bonds and Securities
items.comment: Enter the account type and dollar value of short-term investments that will be maturing in less than 12 months (for example, certificates of deposit, treasury bills, hedging account equity, etc.).

items.name: Accounts Receivable
items.comment: Enter the account names and balances of money due to be paid within the next 12 months to the applicant for goods or services delivered.

items.name: Crop Inventory
items.comment: In each row, enter the types of crops and feed on hand (in inventory) on the farm or in commercial storage.

items.name: Unit of Measure
items.comment: For each row of crops entered in 1D, enter the unit of measure (weight, bushels, tons, etc.) for that crop type.

items.name: # Units
items.comment: For each row of crops entered in 1D, enter the number of units (entered in column 1E) held in storage.

items.name: $/Unit
items.comment:
For each row of crops entered in 1D, enter the price per unit of measure (1E). 

Note: Prices should reflect market values for the date of the balance sheet.

items.name: $ Value
items.comment:
For each row entered in 1D, enter the total crop value. 

Note: Calculate the total value by multiplying the number of units by the price per unit.

items.name: Growing Crops
items.comment: In each row, enter each type of crop that is presently growing in the field as of the date of this balance sheet.

items.name: # Acres
items.comment:
For each row of crops entered in 1H, enter the total number of acres per crop.

Note: If you are growing less than an acre, you can respond using a fraction of an acre.

items.name: Cost/Acre
items.comment: For each row of crops entered in 1H, enter the estimated cost per acre for inputs, such as seed, feritilizer, fuel, etc.

items.name: $ Value
items.comment:
For each row of crops entered in 1H, enter the total value of each crop. 

Note: Calculate the total value of each crop by multiplying the number of acres by the cost per acre.

items.name: Market Livestock-Poultry
items.comment: In each row, enter the types of livestock or poultry that will be sold within 12 months.

items.name: # Head
items.comment: For each row of livestock or poultry (entered in column 1K), enter the number of livestock/poultry to be sold.

items.name: Weight
items.comment: For each row of livestock or poultry (entered in column 1K), enter the average weight (per unit head) for each type of livestock/poultry to be sold.

items.name: $/Unit
items.comment: For each row of livestock or poultry (entered in column 1K), enter the market price per unit as of the date of this balance sheet.

items.name: $ Value
items.comment:
For each row of livestock or poultry (entered in column 1K), enter the total value of each type of livestock to be sold. 

Note: Calculate the total value of each type of livestock to be sold by multiplying the number of livestock/poultry by the weight by the market price per unit.

items.name: Livestock Products
items.comment: In each row, enter the type of livestock products that will be sold within 12 months (for example, meat, eggs, fur, leather, wool, etc.).

items.name: Unit of Measure
items.comment: For each row of livestock products (entered in column 1O), enter the unit of measure for that product type.

items.name: # Units
items.comment: For each row of livestock products (entered in column 1O), enter the number of units held in inventory.

items.name: $/Unit
items.comment: For each row of livestock products (entered in column 1O), enter the price per unit for each product as of the date of this balance sheet.

items.name: $ Value
items.comment:
For each row of livestock products (entered in column 1O), enter the total value for each type of livestock product. 

Note: Calculate the total value for each type of livestock product by multiplying the number of units by the price per unit.

items.name: Prepaid Expenses and Supplies
items.comment:
In these rows, specify supplies on hand and/or prepaid expenses and enter the total value of each. Examples of supplies on hand include fertilizers, seeds, chemicals, fuel, etc. 

Note: The value of prepaid expenses should reflect the actual costs.

items.name: Other Current Assets
items.comment: Enter the description and value of any other current asset that has not been accounted for on this form. Other current include trade receivables, cash surrender of life insurance, advances paid to employees or suppliers, etc.

items.name: Total Current Assets
items.comment: Enter the total value of all current assets listed in Items 1A through 1T.

parts.name: Part B
parts.description: Current liabilities are FARM debts that are owed and to be paid within the next 12 months.
parts.title: Current Liabilities

items.name: Accounts Payable
items.comment:
Enter the name of the lender, dealer, bank, or individual to whom money was due and payable within the last 30 days. For each account, enter the past due amount as of the date of this balance sheet (in the $ Amount column). 

Note: This includes suppliers, credit cards, land rent/lease payments, vet bills, IRS debts, bank fees, and open accounts.

items.name: Income Taxes Payable
items.comment: Enter the total income taxes owed as of the date of this balance sheet. This includes State, Federal Income, and Social Security taxes.

items.name: Real Estate Taxes Payable
items.comment: Enter any taxes owed on real estate and/or personal property as of the date of this balance sheet.

items.name: Creditor
items.comment:
For items (1) through (4), enter the name of each creditor for notes due within the next 12 months. 

Note: This includes any installments due within the next 12 months for longer-term liabilities.

items.name: Purpose
items.comment: For items (1) through (4), enter the purpose of each loan/note.

items.name: Interest Rate
items.comment: For items (1) through (4), enter the interest rate for each note.

items.name: Accrued Interest
items.comment: For items (1) through (4), enter the accrued interest for each note listed as of the date of this balance sheet.

items.name: Payment Amount
items.comment: For items (1) through (4), enter the amount due within the next 12 months for each note listed.

items.name: Next Payment Date
items.comment: For items (1) through (4), enter the date the next payment is due.

items.name: Principal Balance
items.comment: For items (1) through (4), enter the unpaid principal balance for each note as of the date of this balance sheet.

items.name: Accrued Interest On
items.comment: Enter the total accrued interest for Current Liabilities, Intermediate Liabilities, and Long-term Liabilities.

items.name: Current Portion of Principal Due On
items.comment: Enter the current portion of principal due on Intermediate Liabilities and Long-term Liabilities.

items.name: Other Current Liabilities
items.comment: In the spaces provided, enter the name of the creditor and the amount due for any other liabilities (due within the next 12 months) that are not listed above.

items.name: Total Current Liabilities
items.comment: Enter the total value of all current liabilities listed in items 2A through 2M.

parts.name: Part C
parts.description: Intermediate assets are assets with a useful life of 2-7 years.
parts.title: Intermediate Assets

items.name: Machinery & Equipment/Farm Vehicles
items.comment: Enter the total value of machinery and equipment (item 12J on page 4).

items.name: Breeding Stock
items.comment: In each row, specify each type of breeding stock owned.

items.name: Raised or Purchased
items.comment: For each type of breeding stock specified in column 3B, enter R for raised or P for purchased.

items.name: # Head
items.comment: For each type of breeding stock specified in column 3B, enter the animal headcount.

items.name: $/Head
items.comment: For each type of breeding stock specified in column 3B, enter the current market price per animal for each type (as of the date of this balance sheet).

items.name: $ Value
items.comment:
For each type of breeding stock specified in column 3B, enter the value.  

Note: Calculate the value by multiplying the number of heads by the price per head.

items.name: Notes Receivable
items.comment: Enter accounts and money owed to the applicant that will not be received in the current year, but will be received within 10 years.

items.name: Not Readily Marketable Bonds and Securities
items.comment: Enter other investments and the value of each. Examples include certificates of deposit, treasury bills, etc.

items.name: Other Intermediate Assets
items.comment: Enter other intermediate assets and the value of each. Other assets include co-op stock, life insurance cash value, etc.

items.name: Total Intermediate Assets
items.comment: Enter the total of all intermediate farm assets by adding items 3A through 3 H.

parts.name: Part D
parts.description: Long term assets are assets with a useful life of longer than 7 years.
parts.title: Long Term Assets

items.name: Building and Improvements
items.comment: List all buildings and improvements owned and the value of each.

items.name: Real Estate Land
items.comment: Provide a brief description of each real estate parcel owned in each row.

items.name: Total Acres
items.comment: Enter total acres for the parcels listed in 4B.

items.name: Cros Acres
items.comment: Enter total crop acres for the land listed in 4B.

items.name: % Owned
items.comment: Enter the percent of ownership the applicant holds for land listed in 4B.

items.name: $/Acre
items.comment: Enter the market value per acre for the land listed in 4B.

items.name: $ Value
items.comment: Enter the total value of the land by multiplying the number of acres by the percentage of ownership by the value per acre.

items.name: Other Long Term Assets
items.comment: Enter the description and current market value of any other type of long-term farm asset already not listed on this form.

items.name: Total Long Term Assets
items.comment: Enter the total value of all long-term assets by adding 4A through 4G.

items.name: Total Farm Assets
items.comment:
Enter the total value of all farm assets listed.  

Note: Total current assets (1U) + total intermediate assets (3I) + total long term assets (4H) = total farm assets (4I).

parts.name: Part E
parts.description: Intermediate liabilities are liabilities with a term of 2-7 years.
parts.title: Intermediate Liabilities

items.name: Creditor
items.comment: For items (1) through (7), enter the name of each creditor for notes due within 2-7 years.

items.name: Purpose
items.comment: For items (1) through (7), enter the purpose for each note.

items.name: Interest Rate
items.comment: For items (1) through (7), enter the interest rate for each note listed.

items.name: Accrued Interest
items.comment: For items (1) through (7), enter the accrued interest for each note listed as of the date of this balance sheet.

items.name: Payment Amount
items.comment: For items (1) through (7), enter the monthly or quarterly amount due for each note listed.

items.name: Next Payment Date
items.comment: For items (1) through (7), enter the date the next payment is due.

items.name: Principal Balance
items.comment: For items (1) through (7), enter the unpaid principal balance for each note as of the date of this balance sheet.

items.name: Total Intermediate Liabilities
items.comment: For items (1) through (7), enter the total of all intermediate liabilities from 5G.

parts.name: Part F
parts.description: Long term liabilities are liabilities with a term longer than 7 years.
parts.title: Long Term Liabilities

items.name: Creditor
items.comment: For items (1) through (7), enter the name of each creditor for notes due longer than 7 years.

items.name: Purpose
items.comment: For items (1) through (7), enter the purpose for each note.

items.name: Interest Rate
items.comment: For items (1) through (7), enter the interest rate for the note listed.

items.name: Accrued Interest
items.comment: For items (1) through (7), enter the accrued interest for each note listed as of the date of this balance sheet.

items.name: Payment Amount
items.comment: For items (1) through (7), enter the monthly or quarterly amount due for each note listed.

items.name: Next Payment Date
items.comment: For items (1) through (7), enter the date the next payment is due.

items.name: Principal Balance
items.comment: For items (1) through (7), enter the unpaid principal balance for each note as of the effective date of the balance sheet.

items.name: Total Long Term Liabilities
items.comment: Enter the total long-term liabilities from column 6G (1 through 7).

items.name: Total Farm Liabilities
items.comment: Calculate and enter the Total Farm Liabilities by adding Total Current Liabilities (2N), Total Intermediate Liabilities (5H), and Total Long Term Liabilities (6H).

items.name: Total Farm Equity
items.comment: Enter the total farm equity by subtracting Total Farm Liabilities (6I) from Total Farm Assets (4I).

items.name: Cash and Equivalents
items.comment: Enter the value of cash on hand, personal checking accounts, and savings accounts.

items.name: Stocks, Bonds
items.comment: Enter the value of personal stocks and bonds.

items.name: Cash Value Life Insurance
items.comment: Enter the cash value of life insurance policies, if applicable.

items.name: Other Current Assets
items.comment: Enter the value of any other personal current assets.

items.name: Household Goods
items.comment: Enter the value of all household goods.

items.name: Car, Recreational Vehicle, Etc.
items.comment: Enter the value of all personal, recreational, or non-farm vehicles.

items.name: Other Intermediate Assets
items.comment: Enter the value of any other personal intermediate assets.

items.name: Retirement Accounts
items.comment: Enter the value of retirement accounts.

items.name: Non-Farm Business
items.comment: Enter the value of all non-farm businesses.

items.name: Non-Farm Real Estate
items.comment: Enter the value of all non-farm real estate.

items.name: Ohter Long Term Assets
items.comment: Enter the value of any other long-term assets.

items.name: Total Personal Assets
items.comment: Enter the total value of all personal assets by adding items 7A through 7K.

items.name: Total Assets
items.comment:
Enter the total value of all assets.  

Note: Add Total farm assets (4I) and Total personal assets (7L) to calculate the total value of all assets.

items.name: Creditor
items.comment: For items (1) through (4), enter the name of each creditor for personal liabilities.

items.name: Purpose
items.comment: For items (1) through (4), enter the purpose of the liability.

items.name: Interest Rate
items.comment: For items (1) through (4), enter the interest rate for each personal liability.

items.name: Accrued Interest
items.comment: For items (1) through (4), enter the accrued interest for each note listed as of the effective date of this balance sheet.

items.name: Payment Amount
items.comment: For items (1) through (4), enter the monthly or quarterly amount due for each note listed.

items.name: Next Payment Date
items.comment: For items (1) through (4), enter the date the next payment is due.

items.name: Principal Balance
items.comment: For items (1) through (4), enter the unpaid principal balance for each note as of the date of this balance sheet.

items.name: Other Liabilities
items.comment: Enter any other personal liability and the amount owed if not already listed on this form.

items.name: Total Personal Liabilities
items.comment: Enter the total value of all personal liabilities.

items.name: Total Liabilities
items.comment: Enter the total amount of liabilities by adding personal liabilities (8I) and farm liabilities (6I).

items.name: Total Equity
items.comment: Enter the total equity by subtracting the Total Liabilities (8J) from Total Assets (7M).

parts.name: Part I
parts.description: I certify that the information provided is true, complete, and correct to the best of my knowledge and is provided in good faith. (Warning: Section 1001 of Title 18, United States Code, provides for criminal penalties to those who provide false statements. If any information is found to be false or incomplete, such finding may be grounds for denial of the requested action.)
parts.title: Warning

items.name: Signature
items.comment:
Provide your signature.

Note: If you are completing this form on behalf on the entity, sign here as the entity representative.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter today's date using the MM/DD/YYYY format.

items.name: Comments
items.comment: Enter any comments or attach documentation that may provide additional information or clarity.

items.name: Quantity
items.comment:
Enter the quantity of each item, if they are the same. 

Note: List items on separate lines if they have different serial numbers.

items.name: Description
items.comment: Enter a description of the type of equipment (for example, tractor, plow, etc.).

items.name: Manufacturer
items.comment: Enter the manufacturer of the equipment listed in 11B.

items.name: Size/Type
items.comment: Enter size and type (model) of equipment listed in 11B.

items.name: Condition
items.comment: Enter the condition of the equipment listed in 11B.  The condition can be described as excellent, good, average, fair, or poor.

items.name: Year
items.comment: Enter the year of manufacture (or an approximation, if unknown).

items.name: Serial Number
items.comment: Enter the serial number (a unique identifier assigned to a particular piece of machinery or equipment).

items.name: $ Value
items.comment: Enter the estimated market value (as of the date of this balance sheet).

items.name: Total $ value of Item 1H
items.comment: Enter the total value of all machinery or equipment.

items.name: Quantity
items.comment:
Enter the quantity of each farm vehicle, if they are the same. 

Note: List items on separate lines if they have different serial numbers/VIN.

items.name: Description
items.comment: Enter a description of the type of farm vehicle (for example, green truck, red side by side, etc.).

items.name: Manufacturer
items.comment: Enter the manufacturer of the farm vehicle listed in 12B.

items.name: Size/Type
items.comment: Enter the size/type (model) of the farm vehicle.

items.name: Condition
items.comment: Enter the condition of the farm vehicle listed in 12B.  The condition can be described as excellent, good, average, fair, or poor.

items.name: Year
items.comment: Enter the year of manufacture (or an approximation, if unknown).

items.name: Serial Number/VIN
items.comment: Enter the serial number or VIN (a unique identifier assigned to vehicles) of the farm vehicle.

items.name: $ Value
items.comment: Enter the estimated market value as of the date of this balance sheet.

items.name: Total $ Value of 12H
items.comment: Enter the total value of all farm vehicles.

items.name: Total $ Value Of (Items 11I and 12I) Transfer to Item 3A
items.comment: Enter the combined total value of all machinery, equipment (11I), and farm vehicles (12I).

Forms.description: A balance sheet is prepared as of the current date. It is generally a snapshot of the customer's assets and debts as of a certain date.

Forms.name: FSA-2038 Farm Business Plan Worksheet (Projected/Actual Income and Expense)

items.name: Name
items.comment: Enter your full legal name as it appears on your driver's license or State-issued ID card if applying individually. If applying as an entity, enter the name of the entity.

items.name: For Production Cycle Beginning
items.comment: Enter the beginning and end dates for the crop year.

items.name: Projected or Actual
items.comment:
Select either Projected or Actual. 

Note: Actual means the actual values for the period being reported. Projected means an estimation is used as the base to forecast for the upcoming crop cycle.

items.name: Description
items.comment:
Enter a description of each crop that will be planted during the crop cycle. 

Note: List each crop separately. If using different farming practices (for example continuous crop, summer fallow, double crop, pivot irrigated, flood irrigated, etc) please list each crop separately, as they will have differing yields. 
It may be beneficial to list crops separately if they cross county lines, have different owners, percentage shares, or yield variations from one area of the farm to another.

Please add additional sheets/paper to account for each type of crops if you need additional space.

items.name: Acres
items.comment: Enter the total acreage to be planted for each crop listed in 1A.

items.name: Yield
items.comment:
Enter the average actual production yield per crop for each crop listed in 1A.

Note: Do not use the average of the combined yields for that crop, because each farm tract will have different yields. Use APH insurance yields. Then use county or state yields, if you have no actual production yields or records from previous owner(s).

items.name: % Share
items.comment:
If you fully own the crop, enter 100%. Otherwise, enter the shared amount from crop acreages planted that the applicant will receive if leased or shared. 

Note: Percent share is the allocation/amount of crop share as indicated on the lease or rent contract from a rent/lease agreement with landlords. It is the shared amount from crop acreages planted that the applicant will receive. This number or amount will be used to calculate the projections for that particular farm or crop based on crop shares.

items.name: # Units
items.comment: Enter the number of measurable units used to indicate quantity or volume; for example, enter 10,000 bushels (for corn), 2,500 cwt (for rice or soybeans),  900 lbs (for cotton), etc.

items.name: Farm Use
items.comment: Enter the quantity or volume of crops held back to be used specifically for the farm and will not be a part of the total projected income calculated from crop sales; for example, enter the volume of hay held back to be used for livestock feed, or grain retained for seed.

items.name: # Units Purchased
items.comment:
Enter the number of units for each crop to be purchased (or purchased for sale). 

Note: Use items 1G, 1H & 1I for purchases only.

items.name: $/Unit Purchased
items.comment: Enter the price per unit for each crop to be purchased (or actually purchased) for sale.

items.name: Total $ Purchased
items.comment: Enter the total amount for each crop to be purchased (or actually purchased) for sale

items.name: # Unit Sales
items.comment:
Enter the total number of units projected to be sold (or actually sold) from each crop.

Note: Consider that some crops could be withheld from sale for feed or seed.

items.name: $/Unit Sales
items.comment:
Enter the price per unit for each crop projected to be sold (or actually sold).

Note: Base projections on state/county prices, existing contracts or previous history. This information must be verifiable by FSA.

items.name: Total $ Sales
items.comment:
Enter the total amount for each crop to be sold (or actually sold). 

Note: Multiply item 1J by item 1K.

items.name: Description
items.comment: Enter a description for each type of livestock or poultry (for example, broiler chicken, finishing pigs, stocker cattle, catfish fish, meat goats, etc.).

items.name: Purchased/Raised
items.comment: For each type of livestock or poultry listed, select P for Purchased or R for Raised to designate whether the animals will be purchased (P) or raised (R), that is, animals that are the offspring of existing livestock, raised by the farmer from birth.

items.name: # Units
items.comment:
For each type of livestock or poultry listed, enter the total number projected to be sold.

Note: Consider that some livestock may be withheld from sale for breeding/replacement.

items.name: Weight Purchased
items.comment: For each type of livestock or poultry listed, enter the average weight per unit purchased or raised for sale.

items.name: $/Unit Purchased
items.comment:
For each type of livestock or poultry listed, enter the cost per unit purchased or raised for sale. 

Note: This could be the cost per animal or the cost per pound (live weight) for each type of livestock.

items.name: Total $ Purchased
items.comment:
For each type of livestock or poultry listed, enter the total dollar amount to be purchased (or actually purchased) for sale.  
Note: Calculate by multiplying items 2C, 2D, and 2E.

items.name: Death Loss
items.comment: For each type of livestock or poultry listed, enter the number of animals lost due to death. In other words, of the total number of units (in item 2C), how many died that will not be sold?

items.name: # Unit Sales
items.comment:
For each type of livestock or poultry listed, enter the total number to be sold after deducting the total numbers that died.

Note: To calculate the number of unit sales, subtract the number of units lost due to death (2G) from the number of units (2C).

items.name: Weight Sales
items.comment:
For each type of livestock or poultry listed, enter the projected (or actual) weight to be sold.

Note: Changes in operations may impact your projected weight, for example changes in calving or weaning dates.

items.name: $/Unit Sales
items.comment:
For each type of livestock or poultry listed, enter the price per unit projected to be sold (or actually sold).

Note: Base projections on state/county prices, existing contracts or previous history. This information must be verifiable by FSA.

items.name: Total $ Sales
items.comment:
For each type of livestock or poultry listed, enter the total dollar amount projected to be sold (or actually sold).  

Note: To calculate the projected total, multiple items 2H, 2I, and 2J.

items.name: Description
items.comment: Enter a description for each type of dairy livestock (for example, sheep, goats, cows, etc.).

items.name: Purchased/Raised
items.comment: For each type of dairy livestock listed, select P for Purchased or R for Raised to designate whether the animals will be purchased (P) or raised (R), that is, animals that are the offspring of existing livestock, raised by the farmer from birth.

items.name: # Head
items.comment: For each type of dairy livestock listed, enter the total number projected to be sold.

items.name: Weight Purchased
items.comment: For each type of dairy livestock listed, enter the average weight per unit purchased or raised for sale.

items.name: $/Unit Purchased
items.comment:
For each type of dairy livestock listed, enter the cost per unit purchased or raised for sale. 

Note: This could be the cost per animal or the cost per pound (live weight) for each type of livestock.

items.name: Total $ Purchased
items.comment:
For each type of dairy livestock listed, enter the total dollar amount to be purchased (or actually purchased) for sale.  
Note: Calculate by multiplying items 2C, 2D, and 2E.

items.name: Death Loss
items.comment: For each type of dairy livestock listed, enter the number of animals lost due to death. In other words, of the total number of units (in item 2C), how many died that will not be sold?

items.name: # Unit Sales
items.comment:
For each type of dairy livestock listed, enter the total number to be sold after deducting the total numbers that died.

Note: To calculate the number of unit sales, subtract the number of units lost due to death (2G) from the number of units (2C).

items.name: Weight Sales
items.comment: For each type of dairy livestock listed, enter the projected (or actual) weight to be sold.

items.name: $/Unit Sales
items.comment:
For each type of dairy livestock listed, enter the price per unit projected to be sold (or actually sold).

Note: Base projections on state/county prices, existing contracts or previous history. This information must be verifiable by FSA.

items.name: Total $ Sales
items.comment:
For each type of dairy livestock listed, enter the total dollar amount projected to be sold (or actually sold).  

Note: To calculate the projected total, multiple items 2H, 2I, and 2J.

items.name: Description
items.comment: Specify the type of milk being produced (for example, dairy cows, sheep, goats).

items.name: # Head
items.comment: Enter the number of heads of livestock in production.

items.name: Production/Head/Year
items.comment: Enter the production per head per year.

items.name: Total Production
items.comment:
Enter the total production per year.

Note: Calculate total production by multiplying item 4B and item 4C.

items.name: Price
items.comment: Enter the current market price per unit of measurement (pounds, quarts, gallons, etc.) for the type of milk produced.

items.name: Sales $
items.comment:
Enter the total annual sales of produced milk. 

Note: Calculate total annual sales by multiplying item 4D and item 4E.

items.name: Description
items.comment: Enter a description of the type of livestock producing the commodity for sale (for example, sheep, goats, poultry, cattle, emu, etc.).

items.name: Production
items.comment: For each type of livestock, enter the type of commodity being produced (for example, wool, fur, hide, eggs, meat from broiler chicks, etc.).

items.name: Measure
items.comment: For each type of commodity, enter the number of units of the commodity to be sold (or actually sold). Also specify the unit of measure (for example, 80 pounds of wool or 1,500 dozen eggs).

items.name: Unit Sales
items.comment:
For each type of commodity, enter the number of units to be sold or actually sold. 

Note: Consider that some units may be withheld from sale for farm or household use.

items.name: $/Unit Sales
items.comment:
For each type of commodity, enter the price per unit projected to be sold or (actually sold).

Note: Base projections on state/county prices, existing contracts or previous history. This information must be verifiable by FSA.

items.name: Total $ Sales
items.comment:
For each type of commodity, enter the total dollar amount to be sold (or actually sold). 

Note: Calculate total sales by multiplying item 5D and item 5E.

items.name: Ag Program Payments Type
items.comment:
Enter all the types of farm program payments or subsidies received or projected to be received during the production cycle. 

Note: List them separately by the program. Keep in mind that FSA may not be able to include all projected payments as income based on Farm Program records.

items.name: Ag Program Payment Amount
items.comment: Enter the amount of money to be received (or actually received) from program payments.

items.name: Crop Insurance Proceeds Description
items.comment:
Enter a description of all crop insurance payments/proceeds to be received (or actually received).

Note: Keep in mind that FSA may not be able to include all projected payments as income.

items.name: Crop Insurance Proceeds Amount
items.comment: Enter the amount of money projected to be received (or actually received) from crop insurance proceeds.

items.name: Custom Hire Description
items.comment:
Enter a description of all the types of custom work performed for income.

Note: This could include machine work, custom cutting, seeding crops, trucking, etc. performed on behalf of other operations for hire.

items.name: Other Income Description
items.comment: Describe any other farm income, such as money from rental properties or the leasing of equipment and livestock.

items.name: Total Income
items.comment:
Enter the total income by combining all the total sales and total income fields from Part A. 

Note: Combine all the total fields from items 1L, 2K, 3K, 4F, 5F, 6, 7, 8, and 9 to calculate total farm income.

items.name: Car and Truck
items.comment:
Enter any car and truck expenses that you are projecting for the operating cycle.
