Note: This does not include loan payments, but does include repair and maintence to farm vehicles. See your tax return for reference.

items.name: Chemicals
items.comment:
Enter any expenses for chemicals that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

Note: This could include summer fallow treatments, pre-plant spray, in-crop spray, seed treat, and organic compounds used for weed control.

items.name: Conservation
items.comment:
Enter any expenses related to conservation that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

Note: Consider any NRCS contract obligations that may require upfront cost, for example the cost of seeding a pollinator habitat or special fencing.

items.name: Custom Hire
items.comment:
Enter expenses related to custom hires that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

Note: This may include custom seeding, harvesting, trucking, and manure spreading that you are paying others to perform on your behalf.

items.name: Feed Supplements
items.comment:
Enter any expenses for feed supplements that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

Note: This may include salt and minerals.

items.name: Feed, Grain, and Roughage
items.comment:
Enter any feed, grain, and/or roughage expenses that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

Note: This may include straw for bedding and specialized feed for livestock development.

items.name: Fertilizers and Lime
items.comment:
Enter any expenses for fertilizer and lime that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

Note: This may include organic fertilizers, for example fish oil compounds.

items.name: Freight and Trucking
items.comment:
Enter any freight and/or trucking expenses that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

Note: This includes the cost of transporting seed and feed to your farm and transporting product to market.

items.name: Gas/Fuel/Oil
items.comment: Enter any gas, fuel, and/or oil expenses that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

items.name: Insurance
items.comment:
Enter any insurance-related expenses that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

Note: Include crop insurance, hail insurance, farm liability, workman's comp, etc. Do NOT include personal health and life insurance.

items.name: Labor Hired
items.comment: Enter any expenses for hired labor that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

items.name: Rent - Machinery/Equipment/Vehicles
items.comment:
Enter expenses related to rental payments for machinery, equipment, and/or vehicles that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

Note: Rental payments also include lease payments.

items.name: Rent - Land/Animals
items.comment:
Enter any expenses related to rental payments for land or animals that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

Note: This includes renting bulls for breeding purposes.

items.name: Repairs and Maintenance
items.comment:
Enter expenses for repairs and maintenance that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

Note: Consider any major repairs you may have for the year.

items.name: Seeds and Plants
items.comment: Enter any expenses for seeds, plants, or both that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

items.name: Supplies
items.comment: Enter any expenses related to supplies that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

items.name: Taxes - Real Estate
items.comment: Enter any expenses related to real estate taxes that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

items.name: Utilities
items.comment: Enter any expenses for utilities that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

items.name: Veterinary/Breeding/Medicine
items.comment: Enter any expenses for veterinary care, breeding, and/or medicine that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

items.name: Other Expenses
items.comment: Enter any other expenses that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

items.name: Other Irrigation
items.comment: Enter any expenses related to irrigation that you are projecting for the operating cycle.

items.name: Interest
items.comment: Enter the estimated amount of operating & term interest to be paid during the operating cycle.

items.name: Total Expenses
items.comment: Enter the total operating expenses by adding up the values from items 11 through 32.

items.name: Owner Withdrawal
items.comment:
Enter the total family living expenses. 

Note: Include all household operating expenses such as groceries, utilities, health insurance, and all non-farm-related debt payments (including personal home mortgage, car notes, and credit card debt).

items.name: Income Taxes
items.comment: Enter any State and Federal income tax to be paid (or actually paid) during the production cycle.

items.name: Non-Farm Income
items.comment:
Enter all income from non-farm sources. 

Note: If calculating gross income, be sure to include payroll deductions in item 34.

items.name: Non-Farm Expense
items.comment: Enter all expenses associated with non-farm businesses.

items.name: Capital Sales
items.comment: Enter the dollar amount to be received (or actually received), during the production cycle, from the sale of depreciable items (such as equipment and breeding livestock) or real estate.

items.name: Capital Contributions
items.comment:
Enter inflows of capital that are not the result of business operations or other income.

Note: Examples include gifts, inheritance, lottery winnings, the gift value of substantial assets purchased for less than market value, and the capital contributions of entity members.

items.name: Capital Expenditures
items.comment: Enter the purchase of any depreciable items (such as equipment and breeding livestock) and real estate during the production cycle

items.name: Capital Withdrawals
items.comment:
Enter outflows of capital that are not the result of business operations or owner withdrawals.  

Note: Examples include gifts, the gift value of substantial assets sold for less than market value, and withdrawals of capital by entity members.

parts.name: Part E
parts.description: I certify that the information provided is true, complete, and correct to the best of my knowledge and is provided in good faith. (Warn Section 1001 of Title 18, United States Code, provides for criminal penalties to those who provide false statements. If any informatio found to be false or incomplete, such finding may be grounds for denial of the requested action.)
parts.title: Warning

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Enter your signature certifying that the above information is correct to the best of your knowledge.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter today's date using the MM/DD/YYYY format.

Forms.description: Use this form to gather applicants' income and expense information and develop a Farm Business Plan. The completed Farm Business Plan provides the business' financial condition, operating plan, and actual summary for a specified time period. It is used for loan making and servicing decisions. The final plan should be completed in partnership with the producer and FSA.

Forms.name: FSA-2150 Development Plan

items.name: Name
items.comment: Enter your full legal name as it appears on your driver's license or State-issued ID card.

items.name: Item of Development
items.comment: Describe in detail each item to be developed, repaired, or physically modified in any way.

items.name: Location
items.comment:
Enter the detailed location of each item listed for development, repair, or physical modification.  

Note: This should include the physical street address or a legal land description.

items.name: Estimated Completion Date
items.comment: For each item listed for development, repair, or physical modification, enter the date that the project is projected to be complete (or a date of completion per the contract agreement).

items.name: Total Cost
items.comment: Enter the cost of the development, repair, or physical modification for each item listed based on estimates.

items.name: Complete Total Cost
items.comment:
Enter the total cost to develop, repair, or physically modify all of the listed items.  

Note: This is the sum amount of the total project cost.

items.name: Type of Inspection
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: Leave blank.

items.name: Estimated Date
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: Leave blank.

items.name: Date Final Inspection Provided
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: Leave blank.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Provide your signature.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter the date that you are signing this form. Use MM/DD/YYYY format.

Forms.description: Use this form to provide information on any planned development, repair, or physical modification to farm land or property.

Forms.name: FSA-2301 Request for Youth Loan

items.name: Exact Full Legal Name
items.comment: Enter your full legal name as it appears on your social security card or state identification card.

items.name: Address
items.comment: Enter your complete mailing address, including street, city, state, and ZIP code.

items.name: County of Project
items.comment: If applicable, enter the county where the project will be completed.

items.name: Email Address
items.comment: Enter your email address.

items.name: Social Security Number
items.comment: Enter your 9-digit social security number (without dashes).

items.name: Birth Date
items.comment: Enter your date of birth. Use format MM/DD/YYYY.

items.name: Telephone Number
items.comment:
Enter your primary telephone number.

Note: This can be a landline, mobile, or business number.

items.name: Marital Status
items.comment: Select your marital status.

items.name: Amount of Loan Request
items.comment:
Enter the loan amount being requested.

Note: There is a maximum amount allowed per applicant.

items.name: Yes/No Question #1
items.comment:
Select your citizenship status.

If you are a non-citizen national, qualified alien, or refugee, you must provide documentation of your immigration status.

items.name: Yes/No Question #2
items.comment: Select YES if you have ever obtained a direct or guaranteed loan from FSA. Otherwise, select NO.

items.name: Yes/No Question #3
items.comment:
Select YES if you are delinquent on any federal debt. Federal Debt includes education loans, delinquent taxes, obligations to Natural Resources Conservation Service, obligations to FCIC, etc. Otherwise, select NO. 

Note: If YES, provide details in Item 9.

items.name: Yes/No Question #4
items.comment:
Select YES if the government ever forgave any previous debt through a write-down, write-off, compromise, adjustment, reduction, charge-off, paying a loss on a guarantee, or bankruptcy. Otherwise, select NO.

Note: If YES, provide details in Item 9.

items.name: Yes/No Question #5
items.comment:
Select YES if you are currently employed (or self-employed). Otherwise, select NO.

Note: If YES, provide the name, mailing address, and telephone number of your employer.  Also, provide your annual income and whether employment is full or part-time in Item 18.  If self-employed, enter "SELF" in Item 18 and refer to Item 14.

items.name: Yes/No Question #6
items.comment: Select YES if you are an employee, related to an employee, or closely associated with an employee of the Farm Service Agency, and provide an explanation in Item 18.  Otherwise, select NO.

items.name: Yes/No Question #7
items.comment: Select YES if you are an active member of FFA, 4-H, or another agriculture-related organization.  Provide the name of the organization that will sponsor you for this project in Item 18.  Otherwise, select NO.

items.name: Yes/No Question #8
items.comment:
Select YES if you are a veteran that has served in any branch of the military or armed forces. Otherwise, select NO.  

Note: A Veteran Farmer without military experience does not qualify as a Veteran.

items.name: Additional Answers
items.comment:
Use this space to provide additional details for any of the above questions.  

Note: Refer to the number of the question when adding an explanation.

items.name: Brief Description of Project
items.comment: Provide a description of the proposed project that you are looking to finance.

items.name: Ethnicity
items.comment:
Select your ethnicity. Select "I prefer not to share" if you choose not to share any information related to ethnicity.

Note: Providing your ethnicity is voluntary unless you are applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant.

items.name: Race
items.comment:
Select your race. More than one checkbox may be selected. Select "I prefer not to share" if you choose not to share any information related to race.

Note: Providing your race is voluntary unless you are applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant.

items.name: Gender
items.comment:
Select your gender. Select "I prefer not to share" if you choose not to share any information related to gender.


Note: Non-binary is defined as a person who identifies as neither male nor female.

items.name: Income Description
items.comment: In the rows provided, describe each projected source of income. For example, enter beef cattle heifers/steers, market lambs, dairy heifer, etc.

items.name: $ Amount
items.comment: Enter the projected annual amount of income from each source described in item 21A.

items.name: Total
items.comment: Enter the projected total annual amount of income from all combined sources.

items.name: Expense Description
items.comment: In the rows provided, describe each projected expense. For example, enter feed, bedding, supplies, etc.

items.name: $ Amount
items.comment: Enter the projected annual cost of each expense described in item 23A.

items.name: Total
items.comment: Enter the projected total annual cost of all combined expenses.

items.name: Annual Total Income from Item 22
items.comment: Enter the projected total annual income from item 22.

items.name: Annual Total Expenses from Item 24
items.comment: Enter the total annual cost of all expenses from Item 24.

items.name: Annual Amount of Payments Due
items.comment: Enter the estimated annual amount of all debt payments due, including the loan being requested with this application.

items.name: Ending Cash Balance
items.comment: Enter the Ending Cash Balance, by subtracting items 26 and 27 from Item 25.

items.name: Asset Description
items.comment: In the spaces provided, list any assets that you own (i.e. your car, 3 heifers, 2 ewes, etc.).

items.name: $ Amount
items.comment: Enter the value of each asset that you have listed in item 29A.

items.name: Total Assets
items.comment: Enter the total value of all the assets that you have listed.

items.name: Debt Description
items.comment: Describe any debts that you have, that is, money that you owe to lending institutions, creditors, or individuals.

items.name: $ Amount
items.comment: Enter the amount owed for each debt that you have described in item 31A.

items.name: Total Debts
items.comment: Enter the total dollar amount of all combined debts.

items.name: Total Assets from Item 30
items.comment: Enter the total value of assets from Item 30.

items.name: Total Debts from Item 32
items.comment: Enter the total amount of debt from Item 32.

items.name: Net Worth
items.comment: Enter your net worth by subtracting Item 34 from Item 33.

items.name: Special Program Information
items.comment: Part A 36. PLEASE READ.

items.name: General Information
items.comment: Part A 37. PLEASE READ.

items.name: Certification
items.comment: Part A 38. PLEASE READ.

items.name: Warning
items.comment: Part A 39 PLEASE READ.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Provide your signature.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter today's date. Use format MM/DD/YYYY.

items.name: Project Advisor Role Description
items.comment: PROJECT ADVISOR ONLY:  Describe how you plan to assist and supervise the applicant during this project (for example, provide education, oversight, guidance, etc.).

items.name: Name
items.comment: PROJECT ADVISOR ONLY:  Enter your full legal name as it appears on your state-issued ID or driver's license.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: PROJECT ADVISOR ONLY: Provide your signature.

items.name: Title Within Organization
items.comment: PROJECT ADVISOR ONLY: Enter your official title within the agricultural organization (for example, leader, advisor, teacher, County Extension agent, etc.).

items.name: Organization Affiliation
items.comment: PROJECT ADVISOR ONLY: Enter the name of the agricultural organization that you are associated with (i.e. 4-H, FFA, school instructor, etc.).

items.name: Telephone Number
items.comment: PROJECT ADVISOR ONLY: Enter your telephone number.

items.name: Date
items.comment: PROJECT ADVISOR ONLY: Enter today's date. Use format MM/DD/YYYY.

items.name: Parent/Guardian Role Description
items.comment: PARENT/GUARDIAN: Describe how you plan to assist and supervise the applicant during this project (for example, provide shelter for project animals, provide daily supervision and guidance, etc.).

items.name: Name
items.comment: PARENT/GUARDIAN: Enter your full legal name as it appears on your state-issued ID or driver's license.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: PARENT/GUARDIAN: Provide your signature.

items.name: Date
items.comment: PARENT/GUARDIAN: Enter today's date. Use format MM/DD/YYYY.

items.name: Date Form FSA-2301 Received
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: Leave this field empty.

items.name: Date Application Complete
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: Leave this field empty.

items.name: Credit Report Fee
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: Leave this field empty.

items.name: Date Received
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: Leave this field empty.

items.name: Name of Agency Official
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: Leave this field empty.

Forms.description: Use this form to obtain funds to start and operate income-producing projects of modest size associated with 4-H clubs, FFA, Tribal youth groups, or similar agricultural youth organizations.

Forms.name: FSA-2302 Description of Farm Training and Experience

items.name: Name
items.comment: Enter your full legal name as entered on FSA 2001 for an individual. If this is an entity, enter the entity name.

items.name: Training
items.comment: Enter a brief description of the farm or related training you (or entity members) have received in farm principles such as farm financial and production management, recordkeeping, and marketing. This could also include college courses, internships, summer jobs, and any other hands-on training.

items.name: Experience
items.comment: Enter a brief description of your farming experience. Include the type of jobs, duties, and responsibilities you have had in farming operations. For example, if you worked as a laborer, what did you do? If you managed a farm, what did you do? How many employees did you manage? What were their roles/responsibilities? Were you responsible for payroll, time & attendance, record keeping etc.? For entities, enter combined years of experience of all entity members.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Provide your signature.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter today's date. Use format MM/DD/YYYY.

Forms.description: Use this form to provide details of the applicants' farm training and managerial experience.

Forms.name: FSA-2309 Certification of Disaster Losses

items.name: Name
items.comment: Enter your full legal name as it appears on your driver's license or State-issued ID card.

items.name: Disaster Number
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: Leave this field blank.

items.name: Crop Year
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: Leave this field blank.

items.name: Date(s) and Nature of Disaster
items.comment: Enter the date(s) the disaster took place and the kind of disaster that occurred.

items.name: Cash Crop Names
items.comment: List all cash crops (or crops grown to be sold) in the year the disaster occurred.

items.name: Feed Crop Names
items.comment: List all feed crops (or crops grown to be used as feed) for your operation in the year the disaster occurred.

items.name: Other Crop Names
items.comment: List all other crops not listed above, such as pasture, for the year the disaster occurred.

items.name: Units of Measure
items.comment: Enter the unit of measure for each crop listed, examples include tons, bushels, lbs., etc.

items.name: Acres
items.comment: Enter the total number of acres planted for each crop listed for the year the disaster occurred.

items.name: Yield per Acre
items.comment: Enter the actual yield per acre for each crop listed in the year the disaster occurred.

items.name: Years
items.comment: Enter the three previous years.

items.name: Yield per Acre and Source Code
items.comment:
Enter the yield per acre for each crop for each of the three previous years.  Enter the source code for each crop for each of the three years listed.   

Note: The source code refers to where you obtained your yield per acre or production information from. Source code options are: (1) for owner's records, (2) for FSA program yields, or (3) using the county/state average.

items.name: APH Insured Yield per Acre
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: Leave this field blank.

items.name: Normal Year Yield
items.comment: FSA USE ONLY: Leave this field blank.

items.name: Farm Operation Description
items.comment: Enter the enterprise or type of operation that suffered the disaster loss.  Some examples include crop operation, cattle operation, dairy operation, poultry operation, etc.

items.name: Dwelling(s)
items.comment: Describe any damage to (or loss of) the residence or other dwellings. Please attach an actual estimate for the repair or replacement of the damaged property.

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Enter the estimated value of the loss associated with the damaged or destroyed dwelling(s).

items.name: Household furnishings, equipment, and personal effects
items.comment: Describe the damage to (or loss of) household furnishings, equipment, and personal effects. Please attach an actual estimate for the repair or replacement of the damaged property.

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Enter the estimated value of the loss associated with damaged or destroyed household furnishings, equipment, and personal effects.

items.name: Farming buildings
items.comment: Describe the damage to (or loss of) farm buildings. Specify the type and purpose of each building, for example, shop, barn, machinery shed, livestock shelter, etc. Please attach an actual estimate for the repair or replacement of the damaged property.

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Enter the estimated value of the loss associated with damaged or destroyed farm buildings.

items.name: Farm machinery and equipment
items.comment: Describe the damage to (or loss of) farm machinery or equipment. Specify the make, model, and year for any machinery or equipment damaged. Please attach an actual estimate for the repair or replacement of the damaged machinery or equipment.

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Enter the estimated value of the loss associated with damaged or destroyed farm machinery and equipment.

items.name: Supplies, harvested or stored crops and livestock products
items.comment: Describe the damage to (or loss of) livestock products, harvested or stored crops, or supplies (i.e. tools of the trade, filters, generators).

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Enter the estimated value of the loss associated with damaged or destroyed livestock products, harvested or stored crops, or supplies.

items.name: Livestock and poultry
items.comment: Describe the damage to (or loss of) livestock and poultry. Please specify the type of livestock or poultry and the number damaged or destroyed.

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Enter the estimated value of the loss associated with damaged or destroyed livestock and poultry.

items.name: Aquatic organisms
items.comment: Describe the damage to (or loss of) aquatic organisms (for example, aquaculture). Please specify the type and number damaged or destroyed.

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Enter the estimated value of the loss associated with damaged or destroyed aquatic organisms.

items.name: Perennial crops
items.comment:
Describe the damage to (or loss of) perennial crops. Please specify the crop and number of acres. 

Note: Perennial crops are not planted each year. For example, fruit trees, pecans, grapes, alfalfa, and vegetable crops.

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Enter the estimated value of the loss associated with damaged or destroyed perennial crops. Include the cost to clear debris, prepare the land for replanting, and to reestablish the crop.

items.name: Other farm property
items.comment: Describe the damage to (or loss of) other farm property not detailed above such as fences, land damage, debris removal, etc.

items.name: Estimated dollar value of losses
items.comment: Enter the estimated value of the loss associated with other damaged or destroyed farm property.

items.name: Total Physical Losses
items.comment: Enter the total amount of all combined losses listed above.

items.name: Remarks
items.comment: Please provide any additional information necessary to help process the application.

items.name: Insurance/Compensation Source
items.comment: List all sources of insurance payouts or other compensation received (or to be received) for losses suffered from the disaster. Examples include insurance claims or settlements, disaster program payments, and FCIC settlements.

items.name: Crop or Property
items.comment: For each source in column 10A, list the crop or property for which the compensation was received.

items.name: Dollar Amount
items.comment: For each source in column 10A, list the amount of compensation received for the losses incurred to the crop or property as a result of the disaster.

items.name: Total Insurance and Other Compensation
items.comment:
List the combined total received in compensation for the losses incurred. 

Note: This is the sum of all entries in column 10C.

items.name: FSA Farm Number
items.comment:
List the farm tract numbers of the land you own, lease, or plan to purchase. 

Note: The farm tract number is available from the FSA - Farm Program staff. For newly purchased land, it is required that you obtain a tract number from the FSA - Farm Program staff.

items.name: County Farm is Located
items.comment: For each farm tract number, enter the county where the farm is located.

items.name: Name of Farm Operator as Reflected by FSA Records
items.comment: For each farm tract number, enter the name of the farm operator as reported to FSA.

items.name: Operator's Share of Crops
items.comment: For each farm tract number, enter the farm operator's percentage of ownership in the crops produced on each farm.

items.name: FSA Remarks
items.comment: FOR FSA USE ONLY: Leave this field blank.

items.name: Statement
items.comment: Please read the certification statement prior to signing and dating the form.

items.name: Signature
items.comment: Provide your signature.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter today's date. Us the format MM/DD/YYYY.

Forms.description: Use this form provide information pertaining to the applicants' losses caused by a designated disaster.

Forms.name: FSA-2310 Lender's Verification of Loan Application (Emergency Loan Use)

items.name: Applicant's Full Legal Name
items.comment: APPLICANT: Enter your full legal name as it appears on your driver's license or State-issued ID card.

items.name: $ Amount
items.comment: APPLICANT: Enter the dollar amount of the emergency loan that you are requesting.

items.name: Loan Purpose
items.comment: APPLICANT: Enter the specific purpose(s) for which the loan proceeds will be used (i.e. refinancing farm-related debt, operating expenses, replacing damaged buildings, etc.).

items.name: Applicant's Signature
items.comment: APPLICANT: Provide your signature.

items.name: Date
items.comment: APPLICANT: Enter today's date. Use the format MM/DD/YYYY.

items.name: Principal Balance
items.comment: LENDER: If the applicant is presently indebted, list the principal amount still owed on each debt, minus any interest or finance charges, as of today's date.

items.name: Accrued Interest
items.comment: LENDER: List the amount of accrued interest that is still owed on each debt, as of today's date.

items.name: As of Date
items.comment: LENDER: For each debt listed, enter the date used to compute the principal balance and the amount of accrued interest for this debt. Use the format MM/DD/YYYY.

items.name: Amount Delinquent
items.comment: LENDER: For each debt listed, enter the past due amount (not paid by the deadline).

items.name: Annual Installment
items.comment: LENDER: For each debt listed, enter the annual installment amount.

items.name: Interest Rate
items.comment: LENDER: For each debt listed, enter the annual effective simple interest rate.  Alternatively, enter an asterisk "*" if the debt has a variable rate.

items.name: Daily Interest Accrual
items.comment: LENDER: For each debt listed, enter the daily dollar amount of interest added to the balance.

items.name: Maturity Date
items.comment: LENDER: For each debt listed, enter the date the final payment is due. Use the format MM/DD/YYYY.

items.name: Loan Continuation Question
items.comment:
LENDER: Select YES if you are willing to continue your loan(s) with the applicant and respond to item 2a. Otherwise, select NO and provide your reason(s) in item 2b. 

Note: Use Item 7, Remarks, for additional space if needed.

items.name: If Yes
items.comment: LENDER: If you selected YES, describe what conditions are required in order to continue your loan(s) with the applicant.

items.name: If No
items.comment: LENDER: If you selected NO, explain why you are unwilling to continue your loan(s) with the applicant.

items.name: Collateral Description
items.comment:
LENDER: Provide descriptions of the collateral used to secure the debt(s) listed in item B1. 

Note: General descriptions may be used (i.e. machinery and equipment, land, cattle, sheep, goats, etc.).

items.name: Similar Loan Question
items.comment:
LENDER: Select YES if the applicant has applied for a loan of a similar amount and purpose as what is being requested from FSA.  Otherwise, select NO. 

Note: If you selected YES, complete items 4a through 4f.

items.name: Amount
items.comment: LENDER: If you selected YES, enter the requested loan amount.

items.name: Interest Rate
items.comment: LENDER: If you selected YES, enter the interest rate for this loan request.

items.name: Terms
items.comment: LENDER: If you selected YES, enter the terms for the loan requested. Please indicate whether it is a revolving line of credit or a one-year note.

items.name: Date of Last Request
items.comment: LENDER: If you selected YES, enter the date of the loan request.  Use the format MM/DD/YYYY.

items.name: Purpose
items.comment: LENDER: If you selected YES, enter the purpose(s) for which the loan was requested.

items.name: Collateral Offered
items.comment: LENDER: If you selected YES, describe the collateral offered for this loan request.

items.name: Applicant Request Approval Question
items.comment: LENDER: Select YES if the applicant's loan request was approved and proceed to item 5a.  Otherwise, select NO and respond to item 5b.

items.name: Amount
items.comment: LENDER: If you selected YES to item 5, enter the amount of the approved loan.

items.name: Reason for Loan Denial
items.comment: LENDER, If you selected NO to item 5, enter the reason the loan request was not approved.

items.name: FSA Guaranteed Loan Question
items.comment: LENDER: Select YES if you would consider making the applicant a loan with an FSA Guarantee.  Otherwise, select NO and enter your reason in the Remarks section (item 7).

items.name: Remarks
items.comment: LENDER: Use this space to add additional information.

items.name: Name and Address of Lender
items.comment: LENDER: Enter your name as the lender's representative, followed by the name and address of the lending institution you represent.

items.name: Title of Lender's Representative
items.comment: LENDER: Enter your professional title as the lender's representative signing this form.

items.name: Signature of Lender's Representative
items.comment: LENDER: Provide your signature.

items.name: Date
items.comment: LENDER: Enter today's date. Use the format MM/DD/YYYY.

Forms.description: Use this form only if you're applying for an annual operational loan and qualify for Streamlined OL Assistance.

Forms.name: FSA-2314 Streamlined Request for Direct OL Assistance

items.name: Exact Full Legal Name
items.comment: Enter your full legal name as it appears on your social security card or state identification card.

items.name: Mailing Address
items.comment: Enter your complete mailing address, including street, city, state, and ZIP code. If you are applying as an entity, enter the main address where correspondence should be sent.

items.name: Home Phone
items.comment: Enter your home (or landline) telephone number.

items.name: Mobile Phone
items.comment: Enter your mobile telephone number.

items.name: Email
items.comment: Enter your email address.

items.name: Loan Purpose
items.comment: Select Annual OL, Term OL, or both.

items.name: Loan Amount
items.comment: Enter the amount being requested for the operating loan(s) you selected in item 1.

items.name: Yes/No Question #1
items.comment:
Enter the date of your last Operating Loan application. Select YES if you have made significant changes to the operation since your last loan request and provide details in Item 7. Otherwise, select NO.

Note: Significant changes may include changes in non-farm income, operations, crops, and livestock that will cause a significant impact on your income or expenses.

items.name: Yes/No Question #2
items.comment:
Select YES if you (or any member of the entity) are delinquent on any Federal debt. Federal Debt includes education loans, delinquent taxes, obligations to Natural Resources Conservation Service, obligations to FCIC, etc. Otherwise, select NO. 

Note: If YES, provide details in item 7.

items.name: Yes/No Question #3
items.comment: Select YES if you (any member of the entity, or the entity itself) are involved in any pending litigation and provide details in Item 7.  Otherwise, select NO.

items.name: Yes/No Question #4
items.comment: Select YES if you (or any member of the entity) have filed a petition for bankruptcy and provide details in item 7. Otherwise, select NO.

items.name: Yes/No Question #5
items.comment: Select YES if you are an employee, related to an employee, or closely associated with an employee of the Farm Service Agency and provide details in item 7. Otherwise, select NO.

items.name: Yes/No Question #6
items.comment: Select YES if you or an entity member have experienced a change in annual income since your last application and provide details in Item 7. Otherwise, select NO.

items.name: Additional Answers
items.comment: Provide explanations for any YES responses for items 1-6.  Use additional pages if necessary.

items.name: Statements and Certifications
items.comment: Read statements and certifications in items 8 - 15.

items.name: Applicant Initials
items.comment: Enter your initials to certify that you read the above statements.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter today's date in the format MM/DD/YYYY.

items.name: Applicant Initials
items.comment: Enter your initials to certify that you read the above statements.

items.name: Date
items.comment: Enter today's date in the format MM/DD/YYYY.

items.name: Applicant/Authorized Entity Representative Signature
items.comment:
Provide your signature if applying as an individual or entity representative. 

Note: For entities, all members should sign as individuals in items 16- 19.

items.name: Entity Representative Title
items.comment: If signing as an entity representative, enter your official title.

items.name: Date
items.comment:
Enter today's date in the format MM/DD/YYYY. 

Note: For entities, all members should sign as individuals in Items 16-19.

items.name: Date Form FSA-2314 Received
items.comment: FOR FSA USE ONLY.

items.name: Date Application Complete
items.comment: FOR FSA USE ONLY.

items.name: Credit Report Fee
items.comment: FOR FSA USE ONLY.

items.name: Date Received
items.comment: FOR FSA USE ONLY.

items.name: Name of Agency Official
items.comment: FOR FSA USE ONLY.

Forms.description: This application is to be used only by those applicants who are requesting an annual operational loan and qualify for Streamlined OL Assistance

Forms.name: FSA-2330 Request for Microloan Assistance

items.name: Exact Full Legal Name
items.comment: Enter your full legal name as it appears on your social security card or state identification card.

items.name: Address
items.comment: Enter your complete mailing address, including street, city, state, and ZIP code.

items.name: Home Telephone No.
items.comment: Enter your home (or landline) telephone number.

items.name: Cell Telephone No.
items.comment: Enter your mobile telephone number.

items.name: Email Address
items.comment: Enter your email address.

items.name: Social Security Number
items.comment: Enter your 9-digit social security number (without dashes).

items.name: Birth Date
items.comment: Enter your date of birth in the format MM/DD/YYYY.

items.name: County of Operation Headquarters
items.comment:
Enter the primary county where the farming operation is located.

Note: Typically, the homestead is used as headquarters or the county where the majority of the operation is located.

items.name: Veteran Status
items.comment:
Select your veteran status. 

Note: A veteran is anyone who has served in the U.S. armed services. A veteran farmer without military experience does not qualify as a veteran.

items.name: Marital Status
items.comment: Select your marital status.

items.name: Citizen Question
items.comment:
Select your citizenship status.

Note: If you are a non-citizen national, qualified alien, or refugee, you must provide documentation of your immigration status.

items.name: Ethnicity
items.comment:
Select your ethnicity. 

Note: Providing your ethnicity is voluntary unless you are applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant.

items.name: Race
items.comment:
Select your race. More than one checkbox may be selected. 

Note: Providing your race is voluntary unless you are applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant.

items.name: Gender
items.comment:
Select your gender. 

Note: Providing your gender is voluntary unless you are applying as a socially disadvantaged applicant.

items.name: Entity Type
items.comment: Select the entity type that best represents your entity.

items.name: State of Registration
items.comment: Enter the state where the entity is registered.

items.name: Registration Number
items.comment:
Enter the entity's registration number. 

Note: The registration ID number is the unique identification number assigned to the entity. The registration ID number is not the same as an SSN or Federal EIN.

items.name: Tax Identification Number
items.comment:
Enter the entity's tax ID number. 

Note: This is an identifying number for taxes purposes. This could be a social security number or EIN number depending on the type of entity.

items.name: Exact Full Legal Name of Primary Entity Contact
items.comment:
Enter the full legal name of the primary point of contact for the entity. 

Note: The full legal name means an individual's first name, middle name, and last name without the use of initials or a nickname.

items.name: Embedded Entity Question
items.comment:
Select YES if the entity contains an embedded entity and complete items 7 through 9.  Otherwise, select NO.  

Note: An embedded entity is an entity that has a direct or indirect interest as a stockholder, member, beneficiary, or otherwise another entity.

items.name: List all Embedded Entities
items.comment: For entities that you have a stake in, are a member of, or are a beneficiary of, list them here.

items.name: Percentage of Interest
items.comment:
Enter your percentage of interest in the entity.  

Note: Each member must provide the percentage owned within the entity (entities).

items.name: Number of Entity Members
items.comment:
Enter the number of individuals that make up the entity. 

Note: This must match your entity agreement. If changes have been made, the entity agreement needs to be legally updated.

items.name: Initials
items.comment:
Enter your initials.  

Note: All applicants must initial and date each page of the application to be considered complete.

items.name: Date
items.comment:
Enter today's date in the format MM/DD/YYYY.

Note: All applicants must initial and date each page of the application to be considered complete.

items.name: Income Description

items.name: Purpose of Loan
items.comment:
Enter the purpose of the loan request, itemizing how the funds will be spent.

Also, indicate whether this will be an Annual Operating, Term Operating, or Farm Ownership Loan. 

Note: If applying for multiple loans, enter the purpose of your first loan request here. 

Do you need an annual operating loan to pay seed, taxes, insurance, to purchase feeder calves or stockers etc? If so, you will need an Annual Operating Loan.

Do you need to purchase equipment, livestock, or refinance farm-related debt? If so, you will need a Term Operating loan.

Do you need to purchase real estate, make capital improvements to the farm, or new construction projects? If so, you will need a Farm Ownership loan.

Please note that more than one loan or any combination of two loans may be requested. If so, please put your first loan request in 4A and your second loan request in 5. For example, an applicant may request an Annual Operating, Term Operating, and a Farm Ownership loan at the same time. Another example, an applicant can request a combination of any two loans.

items.name: Amount Requested

If YES, provide details in Item 8.

items.name: Yes/No Question #3
items.comment:
Select YES if the government ever forgave any previous debt through a write-down, write-off, compromise, adjustment, reduction, charge-off, paying a loss on a guarantee, or bankruptcy. Otherwise, select NO.

If YES, provide details in Item 8.

items.name: Yes/No Question #4
items.comment:
Select YES if you (or any member of the entity) are delinquent on any federal debt. Federal Debt includes education loans, delinquent taxes, obligations at Natural Resources Conservation Service, obligations to FCIC, etc. Otherwise, select NO.

If YES, provide details in Item 8.

items.name: Yes/No Question #5
items.comment:
Select YES if you (any member of the entity, or the entity itself) are involved in any pending litigation (i.e divorce, lawsuit, etc.). Otherwise, select NO.

If YES, provide details in Item 8.

items.name: Yes/No Question #6
items.comment:
Select YES if you (or any member of the entity) have filed a petition for bankruptcy. Otherwise, select NO.

If YES, provide details in Item 8.

items.name: Yes/No Question #7
items.comment:
Select YES if you are an employee, related to an employee, or closely associated with an employee of the Farm Service Agency. Otherwise, select NO.

If YES, provide details in Item 8.

Select financial management if you are requesting a waiver of the financial management borrower training requirement.  

Note: Financial management is applying general management principles to the financial resources of the enterprise.

items.name: Type of Request
items.comment: Select the type of request that you are making.  For a NEW LOAN(s), select "New Loan Request".   For existing borrowers requesting loan servicing, select "Loan Servicing Request".   For applicants applying under the Transfer & Assumption process, select "Transfer & Assumption".

items.name: Request 1 of ___
items.comment: Enter the total number of loans requests the applicant is requesting.  (e.g. - If applying for only 1 loan, enter 1.  If applying for 2 loans, enter 2, etc.)

items.name: Use of Loan Proceeds
items.comment:
Enter a description of the use of loan proceeds.  Similar loan requests can be combined into one request.  Authorized uses include:  

FARM OWNERSHIP LOANS (FO)*
FO - Purchase a farm
FO - Purchase a farm - Beginning Farm Down Payment
FO - Purchase a farm - Joint Financing with another lender 
FO - Enlarge or improve an existing farm
FO - Construct new farm buildings
FO - Improve existing farm buildings
FO - Pay closing costs
FO - Implement soil and water conservation and protection practices.
*FO loans have a borrower loan limit# of $600,000.  Beginning Farm Down Payment loans have a maximum loan amount of $300,150. 

OPERATING LOANS (OL)**
ANNUAL OPERATING LOANS (A-OL)
A-OL - Annual input costs and Family living expenses
A-OL - Purchase market livestock

TERM OPERATING LOANS (T-OL)
T-OL - Initial start-up expenses
T-OL - Purchase of equipment
T-OL - Purchase breeding livestock
T-OL - Purchase materials essential to farm operations
T-OL - Minor farm improvements 
T-OL - Hoop houses
T-OL - Essential tools
T-OL - Irrigation
T-OL - Farm vehicles  
**Operating loans have a borrower loan limit# of $400,000

EMERGENCY LOANS (EM) – Borrower loan limit# of $500,000
CONSERVATION LOANS PROGRAM (CL) – Borrower loan limit# included with Farm Ownership Loan limits

# Borrower loan limit – The outstanding principal balance for a farm loan applicant, or anyone who will sign the promissory note, cannot exceed this limit at loan closing.

items.name: Amount Requested
items.comment: Enter the loan amount requested for this loan request.

items.name: Request 2 of ___
items.comment:
If there is more than one loan being requested, enter the total number of loans requested.

(e.g. - If requesting only 1 loan, LEAVE BLANK.  If applying for 2 loans, enter 2.  If applying for 3 loans, enter 3, etc.)

items.name: Use of Loan Proceeds

FO - Construct new farm buildings

FO - Pay closing costs
FO - Implement soil and water conservation and protection practices.
*FO loans have a borrower loan limit# of $600,000.  Beginning Farm Down Payment loans have a maximum loan amount of $300,150. 

OPERATING LOANS (OL)**
ANNUAL OPERATING LOANS (A-OL)
A-OL - Annual input costs and Family living expenses
A-OL - Purchase market livestock

TERM OPERATING LOANS (T-OL)
T-OL - Initial start-up expenses
T-OL - Purchase of equipment
T-OL - Purchase breeding livestock
T-OL - Purchase materials essential to farm operations
T-OL - Minor farm improvements 
T-OL - Hoop houses
T-OL - Essential tools
T-OL - Irrigation
T-OL - Farm vehicles  
**Operating loans have a borrower loan limit# of $400,000

EMERGENCY LOANS (EM) – Borrower loan limit# of $500,000
CONSERVATION LOANS PROGRAM (CL) – Borrower loan limit# included with Farm Ownership Loan limits

# Borrower loan limit – The outstanding principal balance for a farm loan applicant, or anyone who will sign the promissory note, cannot exceed this limit at loan closing.

items.name: Amount Requested
items.comment: Enter the loan amount requested for this loan request.

items.name: Request 3 of ___
items.comment:
If there are more than two loan requests, enter the total number of loans requested.

If requesting only 1 or 2 loan(s), LEAVE BLANK.  If applying for 3 loans, enter 3.  If additional request space is needed, page will need to be duplicated.)

items.name: Amount Requested

parts.name: Part G
parts.description: CERTIFICATION: I certify that the information provided is true, complete, and correct to the best of my knowledge and is provided in good faith to obtain a loan. (WARNING: Section 1001 of Title 18, United States Code, provides for criminal penalties to those who provide false statements to the Government. If any information is found to be false or incomplete, such finding may be grounds for denial of the requested action).
parts.title: Certification and Eligibility

items.name: Business Under Other Name
items.comment:
Select “YES” if you (or any member of the entity) have ever conducted business under another name.

If “YES” provide names used in item 8; otherwise check "NO".

items.name: Previous FSA or FmHA Loans
items.comment: Select “YES” if you (or any member of the entity) have ever obtained a direct or guaranteed farm loan from FSA or the Farmers Home Administration; if not check “NO”.

items.name: Debt Forgiveness
items.comment:
Select “YES” if the government ever forgave any previous debt through a write-down, write-off, compromise, adjustment, reduction, charge-off, paying a loss on a guarantee, or bankruptcy.

If “YES”, provide details in Item 8; otherwise check “NO”.

items.name: Delinquent on Federal Debt
items.comment:
Select “YES” if you (or any member of the entity) are delinquent on any federal debt. Federal Debt includes education loans, delinquent taxes, obligations at Natural Resources Conservation Service, obligations to FCIC, etc.

If “YES,” provide details in Item 8; otherwise check “NO”.

items.name: Pending Litigation
items.comment:
Select “YES” if you (any member of the entity, or the entity itself) are involved in any pending litigation.

If “YES,” provide details in Item 8; otherwise check “NO”.

items.name: Bankruptcy
items.comment:
Select “YES” if you (or any member of the entity) have filed a petition for bankruptcy.

If “YES,” provide details in Item 8; otherwise check “NO”.

items.name: Employee Relationship
items.comment:
Select “YES” if you are an employee, related to an employee, or closely associated with an employee of the Farm Service Agency.

If “YES” provide details in Item 8; otherwise check "NO".

items.name: Additional Answers
items.comment: Provide explanations to any “YES” responses for Items 1–7.
Check box if you are submitting alternative documentation

If you are an entity applicant, you must DUPLICATE this Part and provide a Balance Sheet for the entity itself, as well as ALL entity members.  If married couplse are completing this part jointly, BOTH the applicant AND the spouse's name must be listed in this field.

items.comment: Enter the account names of money due to be paid within the next 12 months to the applicant for goods or services delivered.

items.comment: Enter the amount of money due for each account listed to be paid within the next 12 months to the applicant for goods or services delivered.

items.name: Type
items.comment: In each row, enter the types of crops and feed on hand (in inventory) on the farm or in commercial storage.

items.name: Measure
items.comment: For each row of crops entered in Type, enter the unit of measure (weight, bushels, tons, etc.) for that crop type.

items.name: # Units
items.comment: For each row of crops entered in Type, enter the number of units held in storage.

items.name: $/Unit
items.comment:
For each row of crops entered in Type, enter the price per unit of measure. 

Note: Prices should reflect market values for the date of the balance sheet.

items.name: Market Value
items.comment:
For each row entered in Schedule C - Crop Inventory, enter the total crop value. 

Note: Calculate the total value by multiplying the number of units by the price per unit.

items.name: Type
items.comment: In each row, enter each type of crop that is presently growing in the field as of the date of this balance sheet.

items.name: # Acres
items.comment:
For each row of crops entered in Type, enter the total number of acres per crop.

Note: If you are growing less than an acre, you can respond using a fraction of an acre.

items.name: Cost/Acre
items.comment: For each row of crops entered in Type, enter the estimated cost per acre for inputs, such as seed, feritilizer, fuel, etc.

items.name: Market Value
items.comment:
For each row of crops entered in Type, enter the total value of each crop. 

Note: Calculate the total value of each crop by multiplying the number of acres by the cost per acre.

items.name: Type
items.comment: In each row, enter the types of livestock or poultry that will be sold within 12 months.

items.name: # Head
items.comment: For each row of livestock or poultry (entered in Type), enter the number of livestock/poultry to be sold.

items.name: Weight
items.comment: For each row of livestock or poultry (entered in Type), enter the average weight (per unit head) for each type of livestock/poultry to be sold.

items.name: $/Unit
items.comment: For each row of livestock or poultry (entered in Type), enter the market price per unit as of the date of this balance sheet.

items.name: Market Value
items.comment:
For each row of livestock or poultry (entered in Type), enter the total value of each type of livestock to be sold. 

Note: Calculate the total value of each type of livestock to be sold by multiplying the number of livestock/poultry by the weight by the market price per unit.

items.name: Type
items.comment: In each row, enter the type of livestock products that will be sold within 12 months (for example, meat, eggs, fur, leather, wool, etc.).

items.name: Measure
items.comment: For each row of livestock products (entered in Type), enter the unit of measure for that product type.

items.name: # Units
items.comment: For each row of livestock products (entered in Type), enter the number of units held in inventory.

items.name: $/Unit
items.comment: For each row of livestock products (entered in Type), enter the price per unit for each product as of the date of this balance sheet.

items.name: Market Value
items.comment:
For each row of livestock products (entered in Type), enter the total value for each type of livestock product. 

Note: Calculate the total value for each type of livestock product by multiplying the number of units by the price per unit.

Note: The value of prepaid expenses should reflect the actual costs.

items.name: Market Value
